Programmatic Native

 

As native advertising and programmatic buying and selling gain ground online, Publicis' VivaKi continues to make noise that native and programmatic are important product offerings. VivaKi is teaming up with Nativo and TripleLift for its latest offering, Audience On Demand Native, says The WSJ <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001cihHrkkkExV9D7cquVdoEa_L2Tt8FSUlyQu0GG-JmAxbo2o4GO6qt8AmZe43GxwC4uDgz3naNeONIUBBOE4BqV0EUOpIL-NP-Yi4nlLAZQBC7RZHgcf6lqmXDqB7OycCsKT4TCFR87XLuTlXZmZAgBDEmDu5PIrIojJIzTYLoz3ORizGjqv2CmjEAbSkR3IdrdJq7EBsAfVaVUFuTTQPF_lSJ5S5d7VMMkCs-I43SX2CKaAuTqDeq-7xwSOVBVpTUP8wGDVweM8=&c=TWBeIeJ6qMEp2hajwRlTqZdfYr0ZsXa02enwRRBsy4M70GWghTtpsw==&ch=ohX78bBWTJHbnRDNGHBbfIsi6rfTrSyHiFrzaEPfDBVq7ff7RZAFng==> . Nativo already teamed up with VivaKi last June <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001cihHrkkkExV9D7cquVdoEa_L2Tt8FSUlyQu0GG-JmAxbo2o4GO6qt_wX6dIhplBlme2NyEtVRg3IgwSnPQqhR_AUzQaNJzQe9W2O5ZWqZufkn-YqFyCSVaBCkFuJX790fS9vZVDHSW6_ny51JprsRi_zOBOviH_r0KZ9BhNpmLoyPZaCNpB5_8AxoW2PLTbL83j998igggSvNXTvd9Rw3b4_gF4H1x423UzWarlJqfVn446-H0I2N-Rr1qs-bQP8VzhLU4_UoXDSQjvvN8VAkq7FevYRCZZWWr6rQmr-ZeY=&c=TWBeIeJ6qMEp2hajwRlTqZdfYr0ZsXa02enwRRBsy4M70GWghTtpsw==&ch=ohX78bBWTJHbnRDNGHBbfIsi6rfTrSyHiFrzaEPfDBVq7ff7RZAFng==> , so this seems to add TripleLift's native exchange <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001cihHrkkkExV9D7cquVdoEa_L2Tt8FSUlyQu0GG-JmAxbo2o4GO6qt9hzPk8FWzn8TpevBZVbcpuxdTIKG91RxLgIVLpt-2x1K84D55EQettRt4V-6bkO6iBArxoKu_wbMP0rHA5xTU-F0ccR5HvqUOPbczuqRkrss4zo8HA8lnMN_BYLk36_VBPCJhG90OgD4oINmuYPy4P9E4DsLQNC1oyFga3CpC_9I8WewI-YQD_QfD4I2jUC_xp-Y04kxJ6llQRkoUQa8eWFzbgk3S-nWQ==&c=TWBeIeJ6qMEp2hajwRlTqZdfYr0ZsXa02enwRRBsy4M70GWghTtpsw==&ch=ohX78bBWTJHbnRDNGHBbfIsi6rfTrSyHiFrzaEPfDBVq7ff7RZAFng==>  and a new VivaKi product name to the equation.

 

Offline Retargeting


France-based Tapvalue is using its $2.2 million in new funding to help offline retailers with digital ad targeting, says TechCrunch. It's yet another form of retargeting that echoes everyone from Tapad to Criteo to eBay Enterprises (was Fetchback <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001cihHrkkkExV9D7cquVdoEa_L2Tt8FSUlyQu0GG-JmAxbo2o4GO6qt2EZj6SOKYLE48345ik-c9OuwopNimO23f8yz_vccxSUpJDBAwEGE8yIN-BzInCCbrqjsO18rY29VyUy7125QP6FADg_UfiZSBoGI5GuncjNg-gfJPTNcJjvkFciHGx_mTQLEaZFpLcqqGoOtazCVyyeqZrw0OdfB0RcDWieHMC4pQf8pwyjPYq7zJoF-47Wg7aTWXHFL7ZVz00aQ0R7MJo=&c=TWBeIeJ6qMEp2hajwRlTqZdfYr0ZsXa02enwRRBsy4M70GWghTtpsw==&ch=ohX78bBWTJHbnRDNGHBbfIsi6rfTrSyHiFrzaEPfDBVq7ff7RZAFng==> ). TCs Romain Dillet writes, "Tapvalue collects profile, device and location data. But what do you do with all this data? Retailers can then target and retarget existing and potential clients with ads to make them come back to their stores - Tapvalue can even handle the ad serving part." Ah, a demand-side platform, too, whether outsourced by Tapvalue or in-house. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001cihHrkkkExV9D7cquVdoEa_L2Tt8FSUlyQu0GG-JmAxbo2o4GO6qt8AmZe43GxwC9w4CS8Z7V7e8v-le3GwETCd2csfIbfE8h4P36sPseMV0fMmIWRBM7qEUJIUVOwTFKxyy5mV_4b7239LDRA3EFf1kaT5It7Et8AkgOr47Bm2pHFerdjtKq4Qt-38jAEuxpMADpRalaFobQ6Fea4OmtuhAgILpdil2-g4mTYSkagXzHEjCvEEiLisZAAqFzkxOu5etCKPlobacW0btdBIwJHhphPlqDs7tOQ2lwn9sQsVZk-ir-Hz7aQ==&c=TWBeIeJ6qMEp2hajwRlTqZdfYr0ZsXa02enwRRBsy4M70GWghTtpsw==&ch=ohX78bBWTJHbnRDNGHBbfIsi6rfTrSyHiFrzaEPfDBVq7ff7RZAFng==> .


Contextual Funds

 

UK-based contextual ad tech firm Grapeshot (AdExchanger interview 11/2012 <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001cihHrkkkExV9D7cquVdoEa_L2Tt8FSUlyQu0GG-JmAxbo2o4GO6qt4H7GfB8e_aygSVSV3-jUSJU7HgH6X1EKPH-cFTs5L2xJidK3RLjyzM1P9cDcoEhGY4geiikQA67l_eFBtA86HG6cYvYK4mQ9nF9Ach478gmtKOLXMXfva0_boKxzhOA59OYaYT63fBBDBpODPl0rQp1QkOfl3oAynhoKvA5IETi&c=TWBeIeJ6qMEp2hajwRlTqZdfYr0ZsXa02enwRRBsy4M70GWghTtpsw==&ch=ohX78bBWTJHbnRDNGHBbfIsi6rfTrSyHiFrzaEPfDBVq7ff7RZAFng==> ) said on Friday its new $3.3 million in funding will help the company integrate its technology with global platforms and exchanges. John Snyder, CEO of Grapeshot, says in the release, "Our recent deployments in the Japanese, Russian, and Chinese languages emphasize the global dimension of real-time bidding and advertising analytics." Read the release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001cihHrkkkExV9D7cquVdoEa_L2Tt8FSUlyQu0GG-JmAxbo2o4GO6qt8AmZe43GxwCaDp_q7vyKCJwGDFsadcL3fHR8AikSy6NRUE1qDw393FpRpWx21kaqXoPoBGwgaaSitVKZAkuCBYd0gyY5HivY9ipY0Zo18sdVamNiiomZeH5jg3OT5M0swrA9TOUHMnDeqKHbwuk0AM--Hz4NsY6uVj9uqt0jdnq6K1iC7KlxwgruHbfa-pbQRWY2YxX8vcaXd_ZjlGEvv9lAcEehmfYVA==&c=TWBeIeJ6qMEp2hajwRlTqZdfYr0ZsXa02enwRRBsy4M70GWghTtpsw==&ch=ohX78bBWTJHbnRDNGHBbfIsi6rfTrSyHiFrzaEPfDBVq7ff7RZAFng==> .

 

Exponential Automation

 

eMarketer predicts that programmatic advertising will grow from under $5B in 2011 to over $32B by 2017. As programmatic and real-time bidding expands, advertisers are paying more for ads because what they're getting in return are more targeted and efficient campaigns. In a recent column for Re/code, PubMatic's CEO Rajeev Goel writes, "If we look at it from the perspective of economics and technology, the key shift in programmatic advertising is that the advertiser now has a voice in determining when to place an ad before a user." Read on <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001cihHrkkkExV9D7cquVdoEa_L2Tt8FSUlyQu0GG-JmAxbo2o4GO6qt8AmZe43GxwCBDkeKX1J2q-Wa6znM3qDx6IMS5mSRfwMAALoBf23pUrzaKRIi4Xrr1HKGHzlgHtV5F7yxiuOQwsMtl4LRgAwBpBqivmzttTMrDKUPVcfIidGSi6OThCQcQ_p2XudoAzlxKl4aAW1svcQHP8Snm1XJR4dpIIhAS7MWTg51ZUriACdHKRrwG0Ndkh_W67ByZe2&c=TWBeIeJ6qMEp2hajwRlTqZdfYr0ZsXa02enwRRBsy4M70GWghTtpsw==&ch=ohX78bBWTJHbnRDNGHBbfIsi6rfTrSyHiFrzaEPfDBVq7ff7RZAFng==> .

 

Out-Of-Home Ads

 

Outdoor billboard ads still work, and the FT covers the successful initial public offering of CBS Outdoor as well as the potential acquisitions ahead of smaller out-of-home billboard companies by CBS. Read more from the FT's Emily Steel (subscription). <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001cihHrkkkExV9D7cquVdoEa_L2Tt8FSUlyQu0GG-JmAxbo2o4GO6qt8AmZe43GxwCOEI3zhBsbOYp1SdWsPTSD0jCsnyC4mOSaWDRipNExGVccdZz19vMrEu4dkvWBxgW4k9bNEY1-nEoqsZ-YS-AHlXY3giQG1C2Lk_cXqavAG_2DRn_2bnwyNMkPUgOE2SKzk-jpilh6Q0wzr3T7dowsqB6dGwX8i9DmJOcKApfamQszld2NeqLaQ==&c=TWBeIeJ6qMEp2hajwRlTqZdfYr0ZsXa02enwRRBsy4M70GWghTtpsw==&ch=ohX78bBWTJHbnRDNGHBbfIsi6rfTrSyHiFrzaEPfDBVq7ff7RZAFng==>  This news likely pricks the ears of certain venture investors and startup founders. It would seem possible that acquisition targets could reach into the digital ad tech side of out-of-home - such as ADstruc (March <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001cihHrkkkExV9D7cquVdoEa_L2Tt8FSUlyQu0GG-JmAxbo2o4GO6qt8VKN0TRXoNgoQYcx6td6oRBtlAWll0Y_zZTfvAw_BTmNzCdz7cvE33egfDexLk5ib7q--eL_Q6rEmugxF-Mx8OFlGdyAW4KCDAUl-pIC_UyRi7lRzwFYpRJKRZvZLbYHSvnzWTJu8Fgc1bDw2sp8XY8Puu6jY1V5ItS11Efhwk0j2mk5cuV7PqbYIlTmCCVdUBLx8fNbJlGBcTBr44z4v22PCY1JuR4JQ==&c=TWBeIeJ6qMEp2hajwRlTqZdfYr0ZsXa02enwRRBsy4M70GWghTtpsw==&ch=ohX78bBWTJHbnRDNGHBbfIsi6rfTrSyHiFrzaEPfDBVq7ff7RZAFng==> ) and Vistar (8/2012 <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001cihHrkkkExV9D7cquVdoEa_L2Tt8FSUlyQu0GG-JmAxbo2o4GO6qtyZR6FHAMVw8fVZn6fsFCjSKeRQ4uIa9mX2F4MqJfs6ml40aOgFeNfSPD_MlAfPag-eY7b92ge8NhG28g15SEooFpv3ehlLh5OEN4UAEy65Fq-97bTOYB3cxxypGxoXf2gsnp7sNpt6D1tYhQlTEiNxxDMk0SISIYMbJkccI7D3D6DlPhWcWoTk1KMlvTAM1VWj2OMbArD1VJeby7--cREw6vc9ZvJjwtNeRBVFk0sd9Oh1dlIXlNXnurPO4meIfwQ==&c=TWBeIeJ6qMEp2hajwRlTqZdfYr0ZsXa02enwRRBsy4M70GWghTtpsw==&ch=ohX78bBWTJHbnRDNGHBbfIsi6rfTrSyHiFrzaEPfDBVq7ff7RZAFng==> ).

 

Yahoo Tube

 

Giving away a 45% ad revenue share and a lack of on-site promotion has apparently created a window for Yahoo to poach some of the better-known YouTube creators and build its own YouTube, according to Re/code's Peter Kafka. That's quite a hill to climb. Kafka adds, "New YouTube head Susan Wojcicki has begun making overtures to its most high-profile producers, said sources, with an eye to making them happier." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001cihHrkkkExV9D7cquVdoEa_L2Tt8FSUlyQu0GG-JmAxbo2o4GO6qt8AmZe43GxwC4Z1eRTF95rGM_MI__R7JB5XMiqFH6MC3sMeJAfWAKL1Q56gld-aS9Z2keCEpUO2adhQ5AE7rNGRw1AYkxHlu2KY0yXq9bsbdoNSJFqC5bQy5f9H-14Q7U_9vODW_Dz2_OPqOtRsjWzXHyk0nhlcGFmNuqFgT48xQljDnIb13-BQNbAcMHz4H7XMQW9k1uH1CoCSM19Tubpw0NWTMor2qjPAq63QSWG2sUyctc4mcMatwftEhyfboHz7IpX64bet_&c=TWBeIeJ6qMEp2hajwRlTqZdfYr0ZsXa02enwRRBsy4M70GWghTtpsw==&ch=ohX78bBWTJHbnRDNGHBbfIsi6rfTrSyHiFrzaEPfDBVq7ff7RZAFng==> . Related: WSJ's Mike Shields says AOL and YouTube are sucking dollars away from cable. Read it (subscription) <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001cihHrkkkExV9D7cquVdoEa_L2Tt8FSUlyQu0GG-JmAxbo2o4GO6qt8AmZe43GxwCIfTJrcBX9u6UpA3_N_44b-SMxBIQy-X1fl7ze6lki5xr-kUF1pvOxZa6mdq6eMEk-Dm1ShfzxqBPXdc-M7eDEKEpyIWHz2dOm_bDPGuAANv3zwRc7zfU9Si0zVwrom4DxKULVy-NnjafS7kLSSyCKIxLdl4TVFAwR5Ae129UEycfjeg0yzSqj30vaE01xsXk3eJDlqf9Kaqes7I--hKG0DnHKICX3kgn&c=TWBeIeJ6qMEp2hajwRlTqZdfYr0ZsXa02enwRRBsy4M70GWghTtpsw==&ch=ohX78bBWTJHbnRDNGHBbfIsi6rfTrSyHiFrzaEPfDBVq7ff7RZAFng==> .

 

Entertaining Exchange

 

Get to know Annalect's deputy MD in EMEA, Cristina Sagarduy, in Jay Sears' most recent interview via MyersBizNet. With questions that range in topic from most preferable restaurant in the world to pinpointing the major obstacles to adopting direct-order automation and the use of the programmatic channel, the exchange is as entertaining as it is enlightening. IBM Invests In Ads

 

IBM says it's investing $100 million into, wait for it, services! According to The Wall Street Journal, a new division called IBM Interactive <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001avDo1Yc2hgQ363Kj8hhKqOFO-8NT-eSwgyTepHZ1IWLVzJ13Gqgm040lBNO1QPz8Sd8ydHtw778gvDs7nh-4_Rn_187p_5Hb4j_r4t92mLRNTl4wyISblDVY76tEBmMq0ra5mXWBIB9k54o8e5fbGXtXpq8KqP9sjatxwIRHpudbVWnv_qlDFQ==&c=nTmi_vZzaf8FZ-c0-piLcWp4eAoCePMRcFjgKBQh21Q73QIGINy5Hw==&ch=_BUt7ZY-_Y7IobRZH7yh8eH2KYyexbq4JPQmGBytCqoDr1FlLPUz1A==>  Experience will lead the charge and "pulls together IBM's digital marketing agency and its other marketing-related businesses such as data analytics and design, all of which are aimed at helping companies target and market to customers more effectively." Read it (subscription) <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001avDo1Yc2hgQ363Kj8hhKqOFO-8NT-eSwgyTepHZ1IWLVzJ13Gqgm040lBNO1QPz85TVvQOcBzfqGCfbeL_2Vq3e_2DCjGQnZUoGeEMDR_f6N4EKMzj78MAlxze9hLT0DDQPnKRsj0m3dbgW7XPLAtvWZluh8Q7BqAts0sN10W3WuZ31VOrEq7Q7CwfMaYS5OHUWhzFmWecvXFHPpGrpBziPIo-nhJuBR8P6OW0UaFL3Hh93p2lNLtseLsr5Xc1Cm&c=nTmi_vZzaf8FZ-c0-piLcWp4eAoCePMRcFjgKBQh21Q73QIGINy5Hw==&ch=_BUt7ZY-_Y7IobRZH7yh8eH2KYyexbq4JPQmGBytCqoDr1FlLPUz1A==> . Agency holding companies keep getting more company. Related: IBM may acquire marketing automation company Silverpop says Atlanta Business Chronicle <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001avDo1Yc2hgQ363Kj8hhKqOFO-8NT-eSwgyTepHZ1IWLVzJ13Gqgm08x5aqm_PXmWeL53sGb4MlrGL9kF1G5J3Vc4WnQU1hauvbCzl7YAj-Bce3MQGJqPRq44xv3BGmHDvFMwpukCyLSiI4yGxYrGQPylGHuCYTyT7v5hHcD_z8fDIsg4RxXO8sIsEZ17IsUDKki-Uv0I8HvyZbjlKDc0MGMyBKm2NJCqwo5Ur3aP2ekYXKD4hZEHBC746_LbD79WjyN5ei0UnnzvrZV5lFGz3vmK_gMZginmgoDbC1zULtQ=&c=nTmi_vZzaf8FZ-c0-piLcWp4eAoCePMRcFjgKBQh21Q73QIGINy5Hw==&ch=_BUt7ZY-_Y7IobRZH7yh8eH2KYyexbq4JPQmGBytCqoDr1FlLPUz1A==> .



Cross-Device Buy

 

Positioning it a cross-device targeting acquisition, four-person mobile ad tech firm Media Armor has been bought by Nomi for an undisclosed sum, according to TechCrunch. Founders Elizabeth Zalman and Eric Brown will move from Boston to NYC and assume executive roles within their new company. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001avDo1Yc2hgQ363Kj8hhKqOFO-8NT-eSwgyTepHZ1IWLVzJ13Gqgm040lBNO1QPz8Ns9qcY5RyYFurzI0R3rw9cJ8WdoyJVWpHYz4dJdu-wFsXRoDJVA_tSysH9wln9H-n08WsPEKCKCEtwAyM1sLQUJ_oeX_Ka4KXqjyA7aulT6npi3UW_9Mt0c4hq8Hk28X9iwyWDbbbMENijviUgcrl-j6tLgYPfF3ja79InK7BWo=&c=nTmi_vZzaf8FZ-c0-piLcWp4eAoCePMRcFjgKBQh21Q73QIGINy5Hw==&ch=_BUt7ZY-_Y7IobRZH7yh8eH2KYyexbq4JPQmGBytCqoDr1FlLPUz1A==> . This follows the acquisition of another firm working in the cross-device space - Admobius - by Lotame <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001avDo1Yc2hgQ363Kj8hhKqOFO-8NT-eSwgyTepHZ1IWLVzJ13Gqgm0_pCH2owKIB2nxzZe2pRIhZd-M-D1nl58mbpAPf5Zaq_24GW4GxXPnxLel03mgyjLm9DGphrocyUkGatxPf9jR_bexB2AGohw_NuyFOF7bgZlFwWg9JDpEyjMDH0Ddhb1i0uM4sCoD1sPYdMA6yGuP6CJ-3zhf62YvXI8jj6eG-s0FRSANjPeVs=&c=nTmi_vZzaf8FZ-c0-piLcWp4eAoCePMRcFjgKBQh21Q73QIGINy5Hw==&ch=_BUt7ZY-_Y7IobRZH7yh8eH2KYyexbq4JPQmGBytCqoDr1FlLPUz1A==> . Some cross-device tech needs a bigger home? Read this article from January <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001avDo1Yc2hgQ363Kj8hhKqOFO-8NT-eSwgyTepHZ1IWLVzJ13Gqgm097JpXI_JjV93b8uawD-hWPH4TTeN4uHrUT3wiD9ETMn4oLRsY5qj9gM0xowTEcLDjegE5RciECLo9qa0phYMlrRVLI8THaBnR4zHxgE3k-A1Ko464K_GOtWdvJxLzTZYgB-WqC72_6K7m4byDGoasEYVwLJ6sxYXDkpCUXyEY7fiK589DuL3_n5CXfQRZjHYEA_63Oxgyn6AD5XxaIITJQ=&c=nTmi_vZzaf8FZ-c0-piLcWp4eAoCePMRcFjgKBQh21Q73QIGINy5Hw==&ch=_BUt7ZY-_Y7IobRZH7yh8eH2KYyexbq4JPQmGBytCqoDr1FlLPUz1A==>  on AdExchanger for more on Nomi. 



Pay You Later

 

Media company Say Media is apparently not getting paid by its advertisers as quickly as it would like. Ad Age's Michael Sebastien writes, "Say Media told publishers in its ad network that it will begin paying them on a 120-day payment schedule effective Apr. 1, slowing payment from an average of 85 to 90 days." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001avDo1Yc2hgQ363Kj8hhKqOFO-8NT-eSwgyTepHZ1IWLVzJ13Gqgm040lBNO1QPz8wFY0KOgzXd-xh_18ly79mKfs_nwbrAtyy5u0iXVVqIbne4qsPCVXdn88rR1gSP1b1gVghitBzNJYb6EC6peqaAo_Uv_m6vkgz_moTvx3vZ3oUn2trYTPqOHzEBUM70w7DmZEXdDadywVTPB6PmK2ASM8dL6mBPffiacw_tUjLX7_8RmeDMlo01QMCT_uX7fLM2lo8yRMISc=&c=nTmi_vZzaf8FZ-c0-piLcWp4eAoCePMRcFjgKBQh21Q73QIGINy5Hw==&ch=_BUt7ZY-_Y7IobRZH7yh8eH2KYyexbq4JPQmGBytCqoDr1FlLPUz1A==> .

 

Bolstering Programmatic


Digital advertising company CPXi banked $30 million in funding to build out its programmatic creative and programmatic media technologies. Along with that news the company announced that CMO Jeff Hirsch has been promoted to president. According to the release, CPXi did $111 million in revenue in 2013. Read the release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001avDo1Yc2hgQ363Kj8hhKqOFO-8NT-eSwgyTepHZ1IWLVzJ13Gqgm040lBNO1QPz8KD_HjgfCKvWLR-dyU0bPbzHB4fv_DnMe7W1RpF7vrOB6mKMKcu94NjCzyzabNz4nCkHjs1eeY8LnV5U7qeLJ7cy9KTcO0_y9OYvD5b0aqCXlzMYd6HNtCWG2kFklc6Q_wpgmasGjrpV8sltqBRvsiQjSLjlTkNu1R5lduJ9fyBn6fcZtxp3MtpHvf_zsEwlu4lrnv-ENpbWsRq4VvsknRw69tcgbnXJjb5riZSFJ88hSok8-C_iZ7SF0Mn52PvTcrSC0BwNyIdw=&c=nTmi_vZzaf8FZ-c0-piLcWp4eAoCePMRcFjgKBQh21Q73QIGINy5Hw==&ch=_BUt7ZY-_Y7IobRZH7yh8eH2KYyexbq4JPQmGBytCqoDr1FlLPUz1A==> . CPX acquired AdReady in 2013 <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001avDo1Yc2hgQ363Kj8hhKqOFO-8NT-eSwgyTepHZ1IWLVzJ13Gqgm09-Bd_9O8GH3LMtErYIEoZkjplQjvRPqROGSkjQDyeQgfzI8zAuDT2nw9EiO-ULOsJp8j4b8gtY_APCR0Chl9dil0UTcS0ZpEtU_5NLNRKLmou9Tgy7nor7qkgBoEFmTNeuTVkhaKr-wMDmiWSMnt1p79MjHIKGH7iBiRNC0eS8SS-PmuasahQIbjWndW7dbdZtJQCThydcb3t81Wci6flczhcL8JmhvMDFfSaZtzbQHOvj8yWAlKZA=&c=nTmi_vZzaf8FZ-c0-piLcWp4eAoCePMRcFjgKBQh21Q73QIGINy5Hw==&ch=_BUt7ZY-_Y7IobRZH7yh8eH2KYyexbq4JPQmGBytCqoDr1FlLPUz1A==> . Perhaps more acquisitions are on the way.

Pinterest To Adopt Native Ads



For the first time, Pinterest is gearing up to launch native ads on its platform. Digiday has the mockups of what we can expect come April. With an initial offering to about a dozen brands and a mandatory six-month commitment, the CPM is set at approximately $30. Promoted pins will include geotargeting capabilities, as well as targeting based on mobile device - which is significant considering more than 75% of Pinterest traffic occurs on mobile. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001avDo1Yc2hgQ363Kj8hhKqOFO-8NT-eSwgyTepHZ1IWLVzJ13Gqgm040lBNO1QPz8NQWdtVbZhP14JJ2y4xWx_lnkh0Su6tOn4iYj_qe6bY9Etaqo7hL0R5K9o1pmkxUc9FrUbY8oJ6Npia0ClvNes3MtyTBgCAHdmoUsxB3Sxgm5NJtEYNdIUw3cB5YKdIBWhMvurZt12h65GniB9j_US19Nmop6oOOTNbjBmbCxZV0=&c=nTmi_vZzaf8FZ-c0-piLcWp4eAoCePMRcFjgKBQh21Q73QIGINy5Hw==&ch=_BUt7ZY-_Y7IobRZH7yh8eH2KYyexbq4JPQmGBytCqoDr1FlLPUz1A==> .

 

RMX CEO Spotted



Former Right Media (acquired by Yahoo in 2007) CEO Mike Walrath is profiled in The New York Times. The entrepreneur gets star treatment. The article includes a bit of advertising nostalgia: "[Mike Walrath] started Right Media with [Moat co-founders] Jonah and Noah Goodhart, two brothers who had been big buyers of DoubleClick ads and were intrigued by an idea Mr. Walrath had for an open auction marketplace for web publishers and advertising networks." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001avDo1Yc2hgQ363Kj8hhKqOFO-8NT-eSwgyTepHZ1IWLVzJ13Gqgm040lBNO1QPz8Hj6LaPOWI_XoJw5XyBxOooaSDvEF-ZbkY4NoDx2DtTh-zKlfjq6KAguaBF8KbAUXbGroG035x4oI2309lxcffwEGysmY55EgW9hElLuZQ-UyCNcOGpLIR_hgrF9O1YABbMGOG4dpSQkS4sBYMtzsTwJ3bvKSkf47ZR4Uf9PlY5-UYvhkdMnOOA0EDtK2Jl2xL1sR95gaITRU78Y0OLKx_bKMVgQ2LMwO&c=nTmi_vZzaf8FZ-c0-piLcWp4eAoCePMRcFjgKBQh21Q73QIGINy5Hw==&ch=_BUt7ZY-_Y7IobRZH7yh8eH2KYyexbq4JPQmGBytCqoDr1FlLPUz1A==> . Yield Times

 

In a short feature article, The NY Times covers its own latest subscription offerings as well as native advertising initiatives ("branded content") in mobile. Times executives continue to spin the "yield" dials. The NYT's Denise Warren says that "the pricing for the new subscription options was calibrated to avoid cannibalizing existing subscribers." Read it <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001GdUYvRToCB5LJrStlKUYqNiYj2bAwZUfb0Lhp5QK1wPzeFL32z8SQZSZNtxUEwV8jN6KpyAC475OjNYe0QuL6lgLRn-_6Mjk8zhTvWVxRrUv3liATCunqAKDSFD9hV8vxwTTxzEztBG1ufERIZMNbAmEovj3tb1bd1vlYRk4IZUnuLeF2PeDGwxens8Q1Fe4GWFe0brj3Mo0aJRzk7i582D3_JEb0gkCxrS4dLJyj5b_rBFj1rsuAmFDryMWO8vrXc3MWqspwn1KDWYX-dGpKCmMPnxofhqkKyVgiybGhyOVRTNZVmAvDA==&c=Szphti9C2UlxsUhrYAdN7yW-ZSn0Sc7l3DpvpSsddqdAaiFaUU6nEg==&ch=IuXWym9BwavJOxDnflSN8IMZfCSngelBiB7bHxaP9f_GyseAqk8F2g==> . And read more about app ads in TechCrunch <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001GdUYvRToCB5LJrStlKUYqNiYj2bAwZUfb0Lhp5QK1wPzeFL32z8SQZSZNtxUEwV8TuNRd-TGSqM8dfoAYliL8VbJdJw47k73A3BIZz2mDsayjnuqCXfM8m3r9J9rH9qsRsTwW-0gWWLba-Z8eZ7ZFI7Cv1HuKtBFHKkgcwmkUY4bCuaD2JQxWO0kZ6-CEPHz3Iy2a6JtmZ68f4DCMOcO01VO0drm60H6qycY8q8R40VufuZ2v-UhLVxRIU3djJUhJDhP_iPgHAvQvPBF3m64PUYtBpERgCAYVEH6OAx_rcbx-WBdkDR97IYBctO-R_2C6XvS0glj0hE=&c=Szphti9C2UlxsUhrYAdN7yW-ZSn0Sc7l3DpvpSsddqdAaiFaUU6nEg==&ch=IuXWym9BwavJOxDnflSN8IMZfCSngelBiB7bHxaP9f_GyseAqk8F2g==> . 


Agency Native


Last May, BuzzFeed partnered with Vayner Media and in August it teamed up with Horizon Media and Interpublic Group. Now, the new media hub has announced a new alliance with WPP's Mindshare. The partnership will afford Mindshare more direct access to BuzzFeed's proprietary app, Fre.sh <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001GdUYvRToCB5LJrStlKUYqNiYj2bAwZUfb0Lhp5QK1wPzeFL32z8SQZSZNtxUEwV830G9IKWSwv0LIQuYHYUosugRy8PWf3MBy8CFM_1cIRsiCRNtsEUna-5NhmKALQBzPncoPKY80_qlGMMCclOmQPlgsc9zHsZI&c=Szphti9C2UlxsUhrYAdN7yW-ZSn0Sc7l3DpvpSsddqdAaiFaUU6nEg==&ch=IuXWym9BwavJOxDnflSN8IMZfCSngelBiB7bHxaP9f_GyseAqk8F2g==> , than any other agency. Mo' native. BuzzFeed exec Jonathan Perelman told Ad Age, "What it comes down to is finding innovative ways of using the data we have about sharing and how we can drive insights for the advertisers that are using this product." Read it <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001GdUYvRToCB5LJrStlKUYqNiYj2bAwZUfb0Lhp5QK1wPzeFL32z8SQZSZNtxUEwV8Y-3GhTX7HI3qaA88OF-VURpGF6lwsBMTj-v9SRPn8WNnPNqmIq_Q1OyVbpQLQsgn_-NSDimJyHHackia94Ng1UQDHptpajJ1WdhUuqQjejKxaw8nkN-ML0EqfkwwP8j_e5goW6-rpqo2UzqNwUjFWeeXotFA2WL-Mrx7Img4TYfo7h-DBqSuVS2MbPfPpzaD12_hJpi_eR19OOGVjDCDAg==&c=Szphti9C2UlxsUhrYAdN7yW-ZSn0Sc7l3DpvpSsddqdAaiFaUU6nEg==&ch=IuXWym9BwavJOxDnflSN8IMZfCSngelBiB7bHxaP9f_GyseAqk8F2g==> . 


Acxiom On The Rock Bill


While Axicom CEO Scott Howe supports increased regulation in the consumer data space, he is not a fan of the Rockefeller Data Bill. Howe is principally concerned that the bill in its current form approves legislation that has not yet been written and, furthermore, "grants the government the ability to create a centralized consumer data portal whereby all permissions are granted," according to Ad Age. Howe went so far as to deem the complications of creating such a portal as akin to the failings of the Affordable Care Act. Read the full story <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001GdUYvRToCB5LJrStlKUYqNiYj2bAwZUfb0Lhp5QK1wPzeFL32z8SQZSZNtxUEwV8l_Yy-RKLMxyHtlCykvLSTiBb0LyRuMJNI7R_4l1u-ebfJkl6tEgY5TRxwCm60PqorpAWiAGziHCUfY2Uyr5x-1GA5pOv4eK_r-Lz0h4t1Kw8Obq3m2vhSVQPUavtCqp73OAnLa1gTZB63KLgolc2NUptz1SWfv06cBZd7ZU1jQefjAxmwEwM02l9PaYgg7lilF76HxKxtt-zo2SWirjlYA==&c=Szphti9C2UlxsUhrYAdN7yW-ZSn0Sc7l3DpvpSsddqdAaiFaUU6nEg==&ch=IuXWym9BwavJOxDnflSN8IMZfCSngelBiB7bHxaP9f_GyseAqk8F2g==> .

Not-So-Real-Time


In an op-ed on Marketing Land, Chango's Dax Hamman opines on what is and is not real-time in display advertising these days. He sees a potential disconnect between the use of media in real-time and data, and writes, "The data being used to determine which impressions to commit to, and at what price to pay, is mostly slow-time at best, and even worse, is often generically grouped based on broad segments that offer little value." Read it <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001GdUYvRToCB5LJrStlKUYqNiYj2bAwZUfb0Lhp5QK1wPzeFL32z8SQZSZNtxUEwV84FfpGivMpG31BUgvCSe110pP88RMVJoS25aSGVnT-r8zuw0LRf26M3xST41Bxrq6pvF7JthGn8bZsha7870skMdk4UrUemoLTpeYSIpSJz_N9FnVIu9_7dWwHHfmUP8Bn14cqswOAbjRAihx43YhMqWd_za2gBwohC7qyTtb7owJUJa7a93qw2ieDDh6x_wR&c=Szphti9C2UlxsUhrYAdN7yW-ZSn0Sc7l3DpvpSsddqdAaiFaUU6nEg==&ch=IuXWym9BwavJOxDnflSN8IMZfCSngelBiB7bHxaP9f_GyseAqk8F2g==> . 



In The DSP Beginning

 

Former Optimal CEO Rob Leathern provides a nostalgic look back at the iterations of his company, which was eventually sold to Brand Networks in 2013 for $35 million <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001GdUYvRToCB5LJrStlKUYqNiYj2bAwZUfb0Lhp5QK1wPzeFL32z8SQfw5x_vjSOOjEyd1aASCVzHzCBhNZPmPB36EenQo9m04lKgocaMisE5K92HwnBnNd9OMp9juP-FZ5Gjl9wxNAFlheQgYCEzo8x01Af5PV8OxBZdtrkOwa30Gsy5wag_CY4NiO70OIvT4byIUhm4Bmv6CzpLwesmuqJvvUVNgK_ZcN9Ouwo6NvaXzkLrINkb99DDK8nl8blh5&c=Szphti9C2UlxsUhrYAdN7yW-ZSn0Sc7l3DpvpSsddqdAaiFaUU6nEg==&ch=IuXWym9BwavJOxDnflSN8IMZfCSngelBiB7bHxaP9f_GyseAqk8F2g==> . Leathern remembers (ripple dissolve) "being called a 'DSP'. Or 'Demand Side Platform'. Yahoo! coined this term and conveyed it to us in a partner update meeting we had with them. They'd been looking for a name for tech companies who were somewhere in between an agency and an ad network model. It stuck." Read more ripple <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001GdUYvRToCB5LJrStlKUYqNiYj2bAwZUfb0Lhp5QK1wPzeFL32z8SQZSZNtxUEwV8GNo3fTO2yPccyYBPze7rjrKZ1YMMkV3vuHfy9jzK-EjxK1j1J792S0eRyj5ohns7nIS65ABcinxq2jM8xeSGml89xsSZnnr5H_cViOU0ecxInmRh1kThTeB0ooN1PXQb7yu03hyrjbGApCbtVqtASghiHsPxfV5z7holKpGAU1tbeEBg7vQWjUTCaqR5-jpP&c=Szphti9C2UlxsUhrYAdN7yW-ZSn0Sc7l3DpvpSsddqdAaiFaUU6nEg==&ch=IuXWym9BwavJOxDnflSN8IMZfCSngelBiB7bHxaP9f_GyseAqk8F2g==> . 


We Created A Monster


"Fraud is the new black," says Doug Weaver in his latest addition to The Drift. Amidst a media cycle obsessed with advertising fraud, are we exonerating ourselves? "We're the ones who have turned a blind eye to the situation," Weaver writes, "the ones who politely avoided the hard questions." Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001GdUYvRToCB5LJrStlKUYqNiYj2bAwZUfb0Lhp5QK1wPzeFL32z8SQZSZNtxUEwV8HgWJOw77GFjBHroqGqqeB2NFM9nyofKuID_YycSsWQ6zoZ1w2jn6ngvsF9s0EJDyBI15VSG9rKh-MUw4iXJoAkUrllvbFfgl1Bcc1aIv8fBV3TN5nvJNriH4rPJScE-2BB6B_79z3HvNEgtTh6ONrQ==&c=Szphti9C2UlxsUhrYAdN7yW-ZSn0Sc7l3DpvpSsddqdAaiFaUU6nEg==&ch=IuXWym9BwavJOxDnflSN8IMZfCSngelBiB7bHxaP9f_GyseAqk8F2g==> 


Mobile Trends

 

Mobile app analytics firm App Annie surveyed approximately 2,500 app developers on mobile monetization trends in a joint study with IDC. Among the survey's findings, the majority (about 80%) of developers sell in-app ads through ad networks, followed by directly selling to advertisers (21%), mediation platforms (19%), agencies (10%) and RTB exchanges (5%). Approximately 58% of the developers, however, did not sell ad space. Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001GdUYvRToCB5LJrStlKUYqNiYj2bAwZUfb0Lhp5QK1wPzeFL32z8SQZSZNtxUEwV8srTwPzhEgNgtYMUALbWL-KHev3JLJEaDQgjCxsvDIdCbi0BnwnSP_-48htBYEfNzUO_MGFGDnyae0gCZ8KKP0z_90UzDtcMTUE9iamRwSOKh4OWLOnjfDm52uMO2r1WDeW5JaUT8FVsUTijk0LdLF0euOiLcrB4gf7RVW3wlhDl7gHHetWGK2p7WvL0-gYRbKNLemhGyZTk7m5uMmbqI-A==&c=Szphti9C2UlxsUhrYAdN7yW-ZSn0Sc7l3DpvpSsddqdAaiFaUU6nEg==&ch=IuXWym9BwavJOxDnflSN8IMZfCSngelBiB7bHxaP9f_GyseAqk8F2g==>

He noted onstage at Programmatic I/O a 'transformational convergence between programmatic and brand advertisers' beyond direct response, and said that this will be the year when half of the AdAge 100 companies will have programmatic specialist teams in residency..." *	Jobs <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001PV0LmTycoGh3SjSjsydMrfeZN8YiQQTO-woVDMuAk4qxZ0LQl4sl8OUnE8YA_XUXpwaSF_yB9H6Jq1fvTHjnUA-B-RQg99YRZ6VS2Fr34blLs8x-JhXHSNcOvVeBFH4QBrWj_bhbjRVwiEb-xKKDsmKy1jEBy3d93ngwleIWeBSFkX3QOQNADA==&c=oW5OsX3X5bo2RUi-triz7cK487UF5zKyiR4rpNcKIjneUJsozBqpqQ==&ch=k8ZIrOdjEweCCqNMYP3gkmtzOQUf9Io4erRY1-tizctfUhiSws6ATw==>  (see below)

 News Round-Up <http://ih.constantcontact.com/fs116/1102602719219/img/94.jpg>   

Here's today's AdExchanger news round-up... Want it by email?
Sign-up here <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001PV0LmTycoGh3SjSjsydMrfeZN8YiQQTO-woVDMuAk4qxZ0LQl4sl8BGsYR_WoLzmTtZ9JujfTGRM0T02j-_b9Yb5YtxNTqVzFrYcEweMGFLadjZJ4uoRCwcXIdC8ts2yeafYWSaoXmdAfExG-EIEOPbputt4OU6w7cIznTGITub_vx-tkGtXFWgrn_XCT9OR&c=oW5OsX3X5bo2RUi-triz7cK487UF5zKyiR4rpNcKIjneUJsozBqpqQ==&ch=k8ZIrOdjEweCCqNMYP3gkmtzOQUf9Io4erRY1-tizctfUhiSws6ATw==> .

 

Exchange Meets The Street

 

The WSJ profiles MediaCrossing and its Wall Street pedigree as the ad business starts to echo financial markets. The WSJ's William Launder discusses what's behind the trend: "Though in its infancy, ... 'programmatic buying' of ads is changing the industry. It already has pushed down online ad rates by exposing the vast inventory of available Internet ad space. The question is whether, long term, it will fully marginalize humans from the advertising business." Read more (subscription) <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001PV0LmTycoGh3SjSjsydMrfeZN8YiQQTO-woVDMuAk4qxZ0LQl4sl8MJq-HcreqnNj3C-HMmK1-DARtDWHX8Z5ZiBeZ1el4LyF_dniu0RueabCFzW0VicGl7arxt5Uim_aIjHoZbf8CieCvj7RToZB_nsNhCBLhfH1ZROt63Xh5c2gzgWM7_8hSub-ZI-EHbsWimA2BRpbI1JdnIj91wVyn38gZmA3scxu1HbTcPgyHxKgthGnAh7QckYmgQVYSkt&c=oW5OsX3X5bo2RUi-triz7cK487UF5zKyiR4rpNcKIjneUJsozBqpqQ==&ch=k8ZIrOdjEweCCqNMYP3gkmtzOQUf9Io4erRY1-tizctfUhiSws6ATw==> .

 

Data Brokering

 

In Adweek, Acxiom CEO Scott Howe takes on his company's critics. He tells Adweek's Katy Bachman, "It's always a great story to have a villain with a black hat. One of the reasons we're the poster child is we've taken a stance. ... The conversation we should be having around data brokers should not be about the companies, it should be around the collection..." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001PV0LmTycoGh3SjSjsydMrfeZN8YiQQTO-woVDMuAk4qxZ0LQl4sl8MJq-HcreqnNn4Uc0Kg9uGLHeJ8hFTP5I9NXBJvQXHIzPsto23POcPFZq8yc1bZuqTiBgh10-3zxY0FChEqk9BZxNB-NqQFhZMsKMf6WG6ChrXiay6V3nGJF0WCmeyn7VtkH8MrzIKeHrotFtiRfmBpO3C2S78qQU2DzowFs3I9jfGXkRS8zT6U=&c=oW5OsX3X5bo2RUi-triz7cK487UF5zKyiR4rpNcKIjneUJsozBqpqQ==&ch=k8ZIrOdjEweCCqNMYP3gkmtzOQUf9Io4erRY1-tizctfUhiSws6ATw==> . 


Addressing DOOH


In a refresh of the QR code, the FT's Robert Cookson profiles how digital out-of-home (DOOH) initiatives from Clear Channel will bring addressable advertising to consumers. He writes, "Clear Channel is betting that consumers will want to interact with ads by scanning their smartphones over special tags on the billboards. These allow advertisers to deliver targeted messages; for instance a cinema could offer discounted tickets through a poster at a local bus stop." Read it (subscription) <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001PV0LmTycoGh3SjSjsydMrfeZN8YiQQTO-woVDMuAk4qxZ0LQl4sl8MJq-HcreqnNbz3n6s7ga4IrJk0a6HtNss6qZpoCQs61U6CDyTMwUpXsEX7G066TguyJlxDqt4FmGIHG_e2br-hDshw5Oik0WHo1MKxnnqzUFDxKWNrMl69EVpRjaocR4Tt8dckRI3kx8uKg3Ik_05xGlLWVl7SwZXNhtPTLW4clVQL0JDq69g7tEmkNZ42NCg==&c=oW5OsX3X5bo2RUi-triz7cK487UF5zKyiR4rpNcKIjneUJsozBqpqQ==&ch=k8ZIrOdjEweCCqNMYP3gkmtzOQUf9Io4erRY1-tizctfUhiSws6ATw==> . And read more about so-called programmatic facial-recognition ads at gas stations in Australia in AdNews <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001PV0LmTycoGh3SjSjsydMrfeZN8YiQQTO-woVDMuAk4qxZ0LQl4sl8MJq-HcreqnN3PWRCoj-JKY-5rmSNBOqBLvXR0s9t2rySylySMLzUWPqzB6_5pBghEPNAGZNZUKllcE44iZCL_6AUdxMW2fqN19hurjR76X6Dst7lTqZMloaVbaZwcwt3FmXy4LAMjgfScXUGUfQi1ROkxYURkUlygTIMECgl5AayV-rMzT7oam_q6Iohv1nWp4o1RxN5bizJ26sBoLJlMx4KzcRY3xcyUwNfULXQjjf&c=oW5OsX3X5bo2RUi-triz7cK487UF5zKyiR4rpNcKIjneUJsozBqpqQ==&ch=k8ZIrOdjEweCCqNMYP3gkmtzOQUf9Io4erRY1-tizctfUhiSws6ATw==> . 


LinkingIn Mobile


Former Dstillery and Google exec Penry Price is interviewed in Ad Age and discusses his new role at LinkedIn as well as that company's strategy ahead. About mobile advertising at his new company, he says, "What we're going to be doing is thinking much more about that user experience. You will not see us running big display ads. We're not going to be doing takeovers. [We're] going to try to utilize the feeds in a smart way and think about what do we make as a differentiated ad product for LinkedIn and its members." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001PV0LmTycoGh3SjSjsydMrfeZN8YiQQTO-woVDMuAk4qxZ0LQl4sl8MJq-HcreqnNjvYg8p4Mm8PFXj7pYjl0JZvKDxiL8YDQ-pppuOZHWugrGb4SdIIJysII3YKkQf9ziKQqWUGLfQm7DltvvrW3_x1sQ4k4Su73zkmNsspttiDrEI8Dh23CXmXOVB7HNOr6Go7luweHxVQii2sR024k6ffgGhvnBuloET7fnQELSxwIlBlZmv78OpD3psLcYhdJu9plI7d1AEw=&c=oW5OsX3X5bo2RUi-triz7cK487UF5zKyiR4rpNcKIjneUJsozBqpqQ==&ch=k8ZIrOdjEweCCqNMYP3gkmtzOQUf9Io4erRY1-tizctfUhiSws6ATw==> . 


Was Direct, Now Brand


In Forbes, Rob Hof provides a summary of some of the highlights of AdExchanger's recent PROGRAMMATIC I/O conference. He notes Google's positioning around brand and programmatic, quoting Google's Neal Mohan: "Programmatic is going to be just as important to brand advertisers as it has been for direct advertisers. Programmatic is really going to reinvent the way awareness- and consideration-based marketing is done." Read it <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001PV0LmTycoGh3SjSjsydMrfeZN8YiQQTO-woVDMuAk4qxZ0LQl4sl8MJq-HcreqnNksRrYz5YOw6OYaIHnPvjO2kWGQ7kx_npdyd9DzURpVFixOp1jvzsL0a7n2NF-W67ey1diFkuQ5LiANJiXZQ5EWfFCtKiW4UAtEVsOTLX6LRqe7jFymneGMi1dVyXNnvpVAnPKE3BonuMglRKM7OXm-C6NxIn4qoQqQ4gsLTIvkxwZYyxf1fQYpDn52VLPM9hz60EloZuoW1OdxBcGPguWRywvaR7irHAied6CkQAVCg=&c=oW5OsX3X5bo2RUi-triz7cK487UF5zKyiR4rpNcKIjneUJsozBqpqQ==&ch=k8ZIrOdjEweCCqNMYP3gkmtzOQUf9Io4erRY1-tizctfUhiSws6ATw==> . 


Preeemium


Responding to a recent op-ed on AdExchanger by PubMatic's Bob Walczak <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001PV0LmTycoGh3SjSjsydMrfeZN8YiQQTO-woVDMuAk4qxZ0LQl4sl8MJq-HcreqnNiyoHxYTPpwDjJoN8ed6Qd2007EiiYbZDC0joZCMe9cQvXaRjh4HI7e7smKmbEXpa4_nhLMe2Krj5ZVWw5hItBZVq_YdhA2GTj9mGyhwcJRMRnHn2KRs-Nb-6oreGMgdxt2bSkCmMrO6oG75jhNOElxsLLv9Ggjpk&c=oW5OsX3X5bo2RUi-triz7cK487UF5zKyiR4rpNcKIjneUJsozBqpqQ==&ch=k8ZIrOdjEweCCqNMYP3gkmtzOQUf9Io4erRY1-tizctfUhiSws6ATw==> , mobile ad tech firm Kargo's CEO, Harry Kargman, says, "What Walczak defines as premium may in fact be premium when compared to the banner buys that are too often being transacted by large ad networks on the open exchange. But, for the most recognized brand advertisers, the quality of content and ad experience is the real meaning of premium in mobile." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001PV0LmTycoGh3SjSjsydMrfeZN8YiQQTO-woVDMuAk4qxZ0LQl4sl8MJq-HcreqnNiyoHxYTPpwDjJoN8ed6Qd2007EiiYbZDC0joZCMe9cQvXaRjh4HI7e7smKmbEXpa4_nhLMe2Krj5ZVWw5hItBZVq_YdhA2GTj9mGyhwcJRMRnHn2KRs-Nb-6oreGMgdxt2bSkCmMrO6oG75jhNOElxsLLv9Ggjpk&c=oW5OsX3X5bo2RUi-triz7cK487UF5zKyiR4rpNcKIjneUJsozBqpqQ==&ch=k8ZIrOdjEweCCqNMYP3gkmtzOQUf9Io4erRY1-tizctfUhiSws6ATw==> .

Demandbase Banks $15M

 

Cloud-based marketing platform Demandbase closed a $15 million round of equity financing from Greenspring Associates to help B2B marketers serve ads. Enterprise digital marketing competitors have been vying for the same territory, such as the deal Oracle struck with partner Bizo on AdFocus. Demandbase CEO Chris Golec stated that "real-time bidding (RTB) display ad spending has become a $4 billion market in just a few years, but it had lacked a B2B solution." He says Demandbase fills the void. Read the release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001S9DAJkZqgMua_OzYx204-ahSPQ6HaziBJVfNXSerA5uzF1f0IGGG__yYPvMcHFgJutUTTx0QUlwt0DrZMzBowYsZkSH7CteW-3aJim9g1YbbLXwsNKA80-FK_cuLVF9AxHSjxb014VOmBvkxJHaEINvQn_gStmtPS0oqhUrDOrjsgA_2tMFDG-Gqsurcg7kp2sxKcaooOkUaxOVPqZDwxmD3s7vbYYEgxJ2bxK58TXJOmqr2KntTfOMuvT2C-TjBS6Vuhje73NfUjnne7JxVuyz2Qwkq0wNkO2SI8HwlkPt7c_JruE2EFhcbpjrf8OjP-AJufAYHxZNMu0TkqDmM83H_o4XXyMYH&c=yZLJCQoZRAk-3Li59izsAEtuKsBjzfiZeycxvAYh6qjQ9i7RpcnH8g==&ch=8tZpRSDnkLrjDWyNeExPcUc-qfe8wVJ144XWsK1w6Yw1kQQ5-IdDCA==> .

 

Mozilla Chief


Mozilla has a new CEO. A year after Gary Kovacs stepped down and Jay Sullivan filled in as acting CEO, the Firefox developer's board of directors appointed CTO Brendan Eich as the new chief executive officer. Eich is one of the organization's founding members and has been its CTO since 2005. Eich promised to uphold Mozilla's mission of putting the consumer first. "Mozilla is about people-power on the Web and Internet - putting individual users, who create as well as consume, above all other agendas," writes Eich in a blog post <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001S9DAJkZqgMua_OzYx204-ahSPQ6HaziBJVfNXSerA5uzF1f0IGGG__yYPvMcHFgJ8qcKDj_dUbPKC0JykK5kcDM-iqsmTtaTxIwdaYPgneQ63LmaCPl_RvDynG4eMEGW8E0LE68JfTyuDOQO-QbX0n2oTSi8hIkwMQzxmyIE6k3isz_cpGvay80nmQx5_uw0oA47zdWWnr93652k7fPujA==&c=yZLJCQoZRAk-3Li59izsAEtuKsBjzfiZeycxvAYh6qjQ9i7RpcnH8g==&ch=8tZpRSDnkLrjDWyNeExPcUc-qfe8wVJ144XWsK1w6Yw1kQQ5-IdDCA==> . Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001S9DAJkZqgMua_OzYx204-ahSPQ6HaziBJVfNXSerA5uzF1f0IGGG__yYPvMcHFgJ4zj_oAY5hMLnx6Cjq2hr2897nhauOiBi6iCNc_2_Fc6Y5C0hCn6QnZehrAmHuzsA7KUFyJR0rk1nR2MQp0UKRQ-LywfUIWrWkx_pRNl7eHBWxH-2ZCLB7h1l-KhZGv5enyJUZtkHlHHHFN1GpVbQHyOq4DTUY3aKU4Uj9Y6stW8TRIXWb2DkUA==&c=yZLJCQoZRAk-3Li59izsAEtuKsBjzfiZeycxvAYh6qjQ9i7RpcnH8g==&ch=8tZpRSDnkLrjDWyNeExPcUc-qfe8wVJ144XWsK1w6Yw1kQQ5-IdDCA==> 


The Tangled Nets We Weave


WSJ tackles the bot crisis with a graphic-laden feature, citing Interactive Advertising Bureau estimates that 36% of Web traffic is fraudulent. To protect themselves, advertisers want more accountability from publishers and platforms so their campaigns connect with human audiences. Read the full story <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001S9DAJkZqgMua_OzYx204-ahSPQ6HaziBJVfNXSerA5uzF1f0IGGG__yYPvMcHFgJt9hKFHOxoH3A8RvLWKfvMqxSUUMTu-GsbspFhfX3SCz2hU1sV52ahxdCvHoQxif6DnHOKBZ-czdhF9zyv_vW0SLwvuH0pdALAqJP0yn0GSDto54_rNKVhHZ9liKGr0SQPZjr6Ltm8co9qIjhbJDP7bk1UYH_zMUcGe23xPxQ3Ro4xEzTxZWRq77ZIYDEWY3bqnvwPachTq1Id8dJ5mQ-nL8Zlun7HFi1PAv8dbhzkbM=&c=yZLJCQoZRAk-3Li59izsAEtuKsBjzfiZeycxvAYh6qjQ9i7RpcnH8g==&ch=8tZpRSDnkLrjDWyNeExPcUc-qfe8wVJ144XWsK1w6Yw1kQQ5-IdDCA==> . 


Facebook Mobile Metrics


Facebook has expanded its in-house mobile analytics while maintaining partnerships with about 13 mobile ad companies. Venture Beat reports the two could be on a collision course. "While Facebook says it doesn't yet have the capability to totally rely on its own in-house analytics platforms, some say it's only a matter of time until it cuts out the third parties." Read what they say. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001S9DAJkZqgMua_OzYx204-ahSPQ6HaziBJVfNXSerA5uzF1f0IGGG__yYPvMcHFgJ8lfENWnP7ttRkZgMPgiLZL29hWM6YxLwa7b07kXrPFsPhtCsrZJiNzz77uJhZY6CQkCPgWqXpWjds0fOqmpAiEHq6DwvXmHAsasslcIS977aPZK26BbXwWlLwateOEN6ZMBGCwwxHSCeJ1cfOAN4vvfjpq84RVWgQx5KMAVdEePH-hlUK7S1tf5rCTaaqNIZhL-YwIxZCn4=&c=yZLJCQoZRAk-3Li59izsAEtuKsBjzfiZeycxvAYh6qjQ9i7RpcnH8g==&ch=8tZpRSDnkLrjDWyNeExPcUc-qfe8wVJ144XWsK1w6Yw1kQQ5-IdDCA==>  


Anonymous


How do "anonymity apps" like Whisper and Secret monetize? Both social sites share a similar interface but obvious brand safety risks. A silver lining? "Advertisers don't have to play it straight on anonymous apps," commented Rohit Thawani, TBWA\Chiat\Day's director of digital strategy, "which is where it gets fun." Read more via Digiday <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001S9DAJkZqgMua_OzYx204-ahSPQ6HaziBJVfNXSerA5uzF1f0IGGG__yYPvMcHFgJwmeCz1Ko51kkdyF21klAl59JYTBVVCF4EiyzYPDHIbJtu1jgHrSlI_GjivU7bMDsiJ4zeP01ll6kuQDnt13X9su2wobMpBXT7GZ2RNLeK-kyGELHyDJ2m3SKj8jmx-M-xnGSAKZ3DyeslC976fgS2OmkIDy7s2khL3d8jEXBeKEX52690VlQuQoy0pyv3P4O&c=yZLJCQoZRAk-3Li59izsAEtuKsBjzfiZeycxvAYh6qjQ9i7RpcnH8g==&ch=8tZpRSDnkLrjDWyNeExPcUc-qfe8wVJ144XWsK1w6Yw1kQQ5-IdDCA==> .

The hotels we worked with wanted to find ways to amplify their product, service and brand on Expedia and our other properties,' said Noah Tratt Expedia Media Solutions..." (visit AdExchanger)

 News Round-Up <http://ih.constantcontact.com/fs116/1102602719219/img/94.jpg>   

Here's today's AdExchanger news round-up... Want it by email?
Sign-up here <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001PaEo1OCx6IsYKiGWQQQhDExsTiuJ6hTEOg5MXmkR4U8YuhHvQ7Q0Pp6ck9Josa0sJg5gBseeBrKuYXn3PgxEjHH7obcZnSNHL6G11OWViJLZ-oHxX4hNgpeGV2PehMneY4lfUJP9zs89FTVCn9tYusnyGQax-Y9OJAFRd1i71ComtrbDngoNV185d-bQyyUj&c=vo4dlPYyXKzxrRdm6oD9wQAQFSH4fhI3nNTHKcsuuKYZacSDRRfLJA==&ch=mDx5R_-xTEKaeDrAaEuIrhbv6zDsC9BQN0JpI_lUkmhn5DvPo_YNrw==> .

 

Replacing The Cookie

 

Facebook ad product marketer Brian Boland delivers on op-ed in Ad Age that suggests Facebook is on the verge of its own substitute for cookies. He writes, "Until the industry adopts a universal standard by which to measure people, it's our collective responsibility to educate all advertising stakeholders about the key differences between people and cookies. And to practice what we preach, we'll be rolling out a new people-based measurement capability soon." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001PaEo1OCx6IsYKiGWQQQhDExsTiuJ6hTEOg5MXmkR4U8YuhHvQ7Q0Pv-22pPevYZb5ICQIa64OrVDNleq5-35VVesMYpbAAI5Dmf3KUn3cXMGZk7E5Qza6Gp9v1_nleu--QmlPFfSg1cmMuPR1ROqnxpGFVWBWlS9BQnh7_8zla7R1EKInTVfroMWE5pX8d1Vq-s6kch1UWTK3mhUIXf04OKeTfAawaOdXAR0mObOMfdeAftzo_RUgtd1P2aYGaSSom0FP4EcJ9c=&c=vo4dlPYyXKzxrRdm6oD9wQAQFSH4fhI3nNTHKcsuuKYZacSDRRfLJA==&ch=mDx5R_-xTEKaeDrAaEuIrhbv6zDsC9BQN0JpI_lUkmhn5DvPo_YNrw==> . 


Cars.com Rewards


Cars.com is "for sale" as its ownership syndicate comprised of newspaper publishers awaits a rare payday amid its own destruction by digital. Nieman Journalism Lab's Ken Doctor analyzes the expected price tag of $3 billion: "That's a big number for a shrinking industry. It's more than 10 percent of all the ad money newspapers will take in this year; it's a third of all the reader revenue they'll take in. It would fund, at an average $80,000 a year, a total of 37,500 newsroom jobs for a year." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001PaEo1OCx6IsYKiGWQQQhDExsTiuJ6hTEOg5MXmkR4U8YuhHvQ7Q0Pv-22pPevYZb7SozOj7ie9rDulYX74hyRdQxWKKXxOcPLfTQZyquZwW8Yzahshyem8BQ4HyGPrl_4wzGQUH4MlsDyN3tGlXTlsph0WrSuG3NSfAapQwC6MTqsOjqL6ZimhMPBmf0NJqy7X5E60P34hB-3K-mAUhgbb1xvRjryv1s6luI8RtP2rZpxwkc2ASy9Q==&c=vo4dlPYyXKzxrRdm6oD9wQAQFSH4fhI3nNTHKcsuuKYZacSDRRfLJA==&ch=mDx5R_-xTEKaeDrAaEuIrhbv6zDsC9BQN0JpI_lUkmhn5DvPo_YNrw==> . 


YouTube Needs TV Logins



At the TV Connect conference in London, YouTube's global director of platform partnerships said Google made an error in allowing smart TV manufacturers to build its apps. Because those apps by and large don't support logins, Google can't personalize videos, as Will Richmond and Colin Dixon discuss in a VideoNuze podcast. It's now reclaiming authorship of its TV apps. Listen. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001PaEo1OCx6IsYKiGWQQQhDExsTiuJ6hTEOg5MXmkR4U8YuhHvQ7Q0Pv-22pPevYZbLR8n3Xagr1tKc_fO7bvoQTGmFl2Hh_FR2PNLsq3T_3JOC0i7jmVgWP8VKyLAmqxPvpW46NJVGjCPJ-xb4vnb6mtJqHuhZPzePOtnTC4aX54b1QEM0dm3ah6CSagh5MB70v0L5K6_b80=&c=vo4dlPYyXKzxrRdm6oD9wQAQFSH4fhI3nNTHKcsuuKYZacSDRRfLJA==&ch=mDx5R_-xTEKaeDrAaEuIrhbv6zDsC9BQN0JpI_lUkmhn5DvPo_YNrw==>  Squint a little and you can see the ad implications. Will Google be first across the line with cross-platform IDs that include TV watching?


Real-Time Value


 Raju Narisetti, senior vice president of strategy for News Corp., responds to an editorial by Poynter's Rick Edmonds that criticizes "vanity" metrics. Narisetti argues, "To continue to ignore the reality of being able to see often in real time and measure and course-correct based on digital engagement data and metrics is a self-inflicted wound that will see our audiences migrate in big numbers to those upstarts that seem to do this as part of their DNA." Read more via Poynter <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001PaEo1OCx6IsYKiGWQQQhDExsTiuJ6hTEOg5MXmkR4U8YuhHvQ7Q0Pv-22pPevYZb8hA0qUHoDKGYy3o2SUI095YKRlvIwmMqLHPz6C6Yh4N9P3fact_JBAPpa_OavmR9al_v1Exol0YyT8rE-dBmKFNght9jhEyiqbTmFU_Hb9ldytGJBGR-7A3dxcwQXfdvcvaldXsuOSm6GhEOhrGATy7FD7QgB1qxyJOUfUVB51rICPeFslIhfbAVVfRuh66K3Jl2ipWeb92QaPN55mICjnZyr_sGk2Mi3E5jKfcqJ8dvkl0StdNtFQ==&c=vo4dlPYyXKzxrRdm6oD9wQAQFSH4fhI3nNTHKcsuuKYZacSDRRfLJA==&ch=mDx5R_-xTEKaeDrAaEuIrhbv6zDsC9BQN0JpI_lUkmhn5DvPo_YNrw==> . 


Overstated Online Video Ratings


Pivotal Research Group's Brian Wieser released a comparative analysis of online video consumption, which estimates audiences of comScore are about three times the figure for competitor Nielsen. Writing for Video Daily, Joe Mandese dissects the data. Mandese writes, "Wieser argues that Nielsen's legacy as the TV advertising standard will ultimately give it greater leverage as advertisers and agencies move to integrate the way they plan and buy TV and video advertising." Read the full story <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001PaEo1OCx6IsYKiGWQQQhDExsTiuJ6hTEOg5MXmkR4U8YuhHvQ7Q0Pv-22pPevYZbKWZD_Ia-g5MZ7CkZK4FMbbt1uJXHZ3Lf5qQDfn_XHbOgJwYtXjGPAH7sGOklIMzrSlRMMhXiepPg05QWmGzr3MfbxWZ5Jdr_v1_6Ve-lrS5bQJDH6A-HMW8xZvDC6Zd68iF_aJ1s9lbUO1nr--zhASsqS96ST1-4OAvna2GYFfTIG7dg7ITtXiMLDnAR-eAtT4JHKqY3_yXMwfoFmxWxK2UCIPOyrDWtrligAiA-QKU=&c=vo4dlPYyXKzxrRdm6oD9wQAQFSH4fhI3nNTHKcsuuKYZacSDRRfLJA==&ch=mDx5R_-xTEKaeDrAaEuIrhbv6zDsC9BQN0JpI_lUkmhn5DvPo_YNrw==> . 


Big Local TV


Marketing tech isn't the only industry to see mergers and acquisitions. Broadcaster Media General acquired LIN Media for $1.6 billion on Friday. Media General Chairman Stewart Bryan said the deal would create the second-largest, local TV broadcasting company in the United States, according to Reuters. Read a bit more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001PaEo1OCx6IsYKiGWQQQhDExsTiuJ6hTEOg5MXmkR4U8YuhHvQ7Q0Pv-22pPevYZb9UjY1TvjbHucKIeVqQKtZ0Osc-fhJiImt0PueD_iPRTy5B4Re2TOC7tTKJsEjb8l_XGWpbr7HRtlmwcIf0zK7YkcjIPeW7HnjgUzv2kijsXVnKhR7-RXmYij7URQSnki15gCjF1bUpO6XkVOOMuThjfFy5BxaYS8AfDW-diPWwwS2SyK_BRmjJgJFfB8Gx2c&c=vo4dlPYyXKzxrRdm6oD9wQAQFSH4fhI3nNTHKcsuuKYZacSDRRfLJA==&ch=mDx5R_-xTEKaeDrAaEuIrhbv6zDsC9BQN0JpI_lUkmhn5DvPo_YNrw==> . This follows last year's acquisition by Gannett, which bought Belo Corp., and Tribune Co., which bought Local TV Holdings LLC, among others. More in The New York Times <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001PaEo1OCx6IsYKiGWQQQhDExsTiuJ6hTEOg5MXmkR4U8YuhHvQ7Q0Pv-22pPevYZbVncrWFCNrt5C7Kfe22qehfEFtGm9PSBegQbD28RCWOViOfUM9a56NF2kbzEp_vEPUbcFi3FqErf_7NymxZIX-2YFvtlRSTSjAiac8qyBxyFCtGkkEqv0_t0X05PdoQbhfrKkWd7SOW5x9N_zcstdQXqIDXsY6B6p90aZrK37qYqBw5rmvnaF6rKCNmwzGNteHo_UxvLEj0B4HSY4-oEyw9Pg2u_afUV0&c=vo4dlPYyXKzxrRdm6oD9wQAQFSH4fhI3nNTHKcsuuKYZacSDRRfLJA==&ch=mDx5R_-xTEKaeDrAaEuIrhbv6zDsC9BQN0JpI_lUkmhn5DvPo_YNrw==> . 


Feedback Looping


The Verge notices that impression levels on Twitter are now being revealed to consumers for their individual tweets - a feature advertisers have long enjoyed. The Verge's Casey Newton writes, "A view count lets you know that even if you're not receiving retweets or favorites, your posts aren't going totally unread." Read it <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001PaEo1OCx6IsYKiGWQQQhDExsTiuJ6hTEOg5MXmkR4U8YuhHvQ7Q0Pv-22pPevYZbjaUvlsR5cOPSTCdUq-v9rnbxYkVwkDtxXv_f87zUwkQSoDWbK0F1GHf3HiEEjp8_Crajyfr85YfS7wxfpJIHkJ_FkAgrbgqvm-UcsIddvC7C5khxMvY2mrQPtFY3xLiltVT0CvJCG4fDuFMYO-jcW4kcP5dQKvyDhh4Ur3-3pZI8409P3zfrQue_MkzFN-sy4Z1vgQ6TctQ5Z2aP1bUYF-O-XUloUYyWKCthPHts6FM=&c=vo4dlPYyXKzxrRdm6oD9wQAQFSH4fhI3nNTHKcsuuKYZacSDRRfLJA==&ch=mDx5R_-xTEKaeDrAaEuIrhbv6zDsC9BQN0JpI_lUkmhn5DvPo_YNrw==> . Consumers need analytics, too.

OpenRTB Revised

 

Guided by DataXu CTO Bill Simmons and Rubicon Project's Neal Richter, and sponsored by the IAB, the new OpenRTB spec is in the wild (pdf <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001_Dysqb_XmxsPf8uX11FvRmv-Hus7utsN3FoiWnLLtyIgZxW2P095UZHNSNGdP6kqvgynZP3jx9xPwopD2qO4Xs6cRFW6syXGT0KVL2qZuC_89PXurOL_-NATWSfvhP9TsRFRvJbAISP_e8nUH7UXlmy8MsGzd8EH18OqvvZLJj9ROEJt_qiK7jFCN1vdetlHtE9ZhUWdIbrSKBI5QJRmZRnRwVZhu8MabvCisYLUSXUeuyPUPWrA382VPIy0ESjcbOResHnlT7gL2d1T9WsiBg==&c=ZISDye2t6xoeT1ukqcoweSVdTHca0KLXVLOrzxlxqt2ME-I2nq218g==&ch=B6BX19I4IsaJUlPqek6uFLxeB4prOOCiU4mczgn-0ZHRksnE0t0B3w==> ). Simmons writes on the DataXu blog, "When OpenRTB was first announced in November 2010, programmatic advertising had captured just 4% of the display market. Fast-forward to today and the industry is projected to hit 22% by the end of the year. I believe that a large percentage of this growth is due to the reduced friction that OpenRTB protocol standardization has enabled." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001_Dysqb_XmxsPf8uX11FvRmv-Hus7utsN3FoiWnLLtyIgZxW2P095UZHNSNGdP6kqtn6YN03wMIvEO8QeDsIEsc0f-IoemKppAwZfYg0rtF2vGlDv1Ghz9h7mUb2aWk_FEAHRp7a_QbQzisKBoGcFcEDEGGvhgRblsxrtNImMvq0bnkO9TFbDol_KanomPuKXB6BXsGlZ04LiXLiKyIb05S8DwvtqaudI7oVSF2ZuApM=&c=ZISDye2t6xoeT1ukqcoweSVdTHca0KLXVLOrzxlxqt2ME-I2nq218g==&ch=B6BX19I4IsaJUlPqek6uFLxeB4prOOCiU4mczgn-0ZHRksnE0t0B3w==> . Also, read Simmons' original Q&A on OpenRTB from 2010 <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001_Dysqb_XmxsPf8uX11FvRmv-Hus7utsN3FoiWnLLtyIgZxW2P095UT8_8RIPKKGzflWnr_F4Bt9SbZVMW-4GzWCbAcJnWY-Q_oAtl-TEJTcodjDpIFnS7ELYlfXv9Yj5_CcUyOuwp1yjS6cP4YnLWSknLCO8n9EbXgFL2HSD1oUXLZ4b-puNIVscsLiZMNveVXjFJhc13oMxzkwIB4QC61gutlO7ZmG8YSli9PfMO1U=&c=ZISDye2t6xoeT1ukqcoweSVdTHca0KLXVLOrzxlxqt2ME-I2nq218g==&ch=B6BX19I4IsaJUlPqek6uFLxeB4prOOCiU4mczgn-0ZHRksnE0t0B3w==> .

 

Jumble Of Parts?

 

Enterprise cloud stalwart Salesforce.com has staked its claim in the sales and customer service sphere of CRM, but how about in marketing? VentureBeat's John Koetsier didn't mince words when he described the enterprise platform's digital marketing stack as something like a "jumble of parts thrown together." But, there is a method to the madness of sewing disparate parts of the system together, according to Marketing Cloud CMO Mike Lazerow, who says there is an underlying vision to link all customers or potential customers "across all of their devices, identities, social networks and media." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001_Dysqb_XmxsPf8uX11FvRmv-Hus7utsN3FoiWnLLtyIgZxW2P095UZHNSNGdP6kqR7FTTdcQ552zNSRhUySlcgXoy30j9QoU7azpbppFm_R27GGz0IVdMq66QOlPZyWqwgpSh2Lux3Lt4djvSa-b9hGBlMRt1e3x6v1tciQ2BfuTzLLdqxCvl1R5wnelxUQ7OR-GJv9PRXIytt0p0xM0Dj6rPV5oKIx61OPxnfbHkw3jGj5pAFZ9NjH58zGzwCQJUlivyvygj4Fl-CvNx67vLA==&c=ZISDye2t6xoeT1ukqcoweSVdTHca0KLXVLOrzxlxqt2ME-I2nq218g==&ch=B6BX19I4IsaJUlPqek6uFLxeB4prOOCiU4mczgn-0ZHRksnE0t0B3w==> .

 

Exploring In-Image Advertising  

 

The Interactive Advertising Bureau (IAB) released the "In-Image Advertising Primer," which dissects their latest in ad types for native campaigns. By inserting product information into editorial photos across the Web, or by overlaying brand information onto videos or rich media, this report shows a 51% increase in viewability for in-image campaigns over their published counterparts. Could in-image ad campaigns be the next essential step for native ad campaigns? Read the full press release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001_Dysqb_XmxsPf8uX11FvRmv-Hus7utsN3FoiWnLLtyIgZxW2P095UZHNSNGdP6kqLL7cOQEu8ihbhQcJlWzNibA1Fc4JIvfJnNx2ckLWHIgwXgimCHOpQWOoBQv_aUUv1CeOw5Mc6uLNkIu5N66v0GxhdQoBOzbIc_H17lZMF5R2bS-pM-wlGU3u-XJUjrlqjXGoZx8Arsqnh0qMa3p6HpL04hO4NigDYte6GLxzR_i7NOI05ByeR6qg2sD3LPNm0F0-k0Rl8wUPRamrYfecJEQ_1SpauJrt&c=ZISDye2t6xoeT1ukqcoweSVdTHca0KLXVLOrzxlxqt2ME-I2nq218g==&ch=B6BX19I4IsaJUlPqek6uFLxeB4prOOCiU4mczgn-0ZHRksnE0t0B3w==> .

 

Amazon Data

 

BusinessWeek gives an overview of Amazon's advertising business, focusing on the restraint it has shown in monetizing customer data this way. With margins constantly squeezed in its core commerce business, investors would like to see that change. "If Amazon is going to hold the line on margins and continue to subsidize shipping, you'd like to see them pull the high-margin levers they have at their disposal," said Robert W. Baird & Co. analyst Colin Sebastian. "Advertising is a big one." More.

 

Reimagining News Feeds

 

It's no secret that newspapers are a dinosaur of an industry, but there may be hope for the business. Tribune Digital Ventures launched a new app called Newsbeat that aggregates about 7,000 stories daily, converts articles to audio and delivers a news stream to users' mobile phones. Shashi Seth, president of the Tribune Co.'s technology arm described the new app as a Spotify or Pandora for news. Users can personalize newsfeeds, jumping to stories of interest and skipping others. Get the full story via Variety <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001_Dysqb_XmxsPf8uX11FvRmv-Hus7utsN3FoiWnLLtyIgZxW2P095UZHNSNGdP6kqpm9gF6k2DhTuymfG7A_UQC7hgGnR_lElAtUbJv5CSyMRIIKdF5uQKLThFra8eCFtG6LUZg_a_eaob1rGBLTBRbw3ySsV0QSmxr68AvDYIgxw3TbqgF0bJE0HSW6s8E-AdOvZCfGW8FwbpnIsqCw4oowwzkPvL9ChQ0VThSo4Wup3ZmrzBih_VpjqQxs6yOPFHbFrxh9ftV8X2CNyy8xIH4DDFM7Yjd2SgsXBKfxFviWfaMzf0LOnMZW2HguroqBN5QDSSpwNLfE=&c=ZISDye2t6xoeT1ukqcoweSVdTHca0KLXVLOrzxlxqt2ME-I2nq218g==&ch=B6BX19I4IsaJUlPqek6uFLxeB4prOOCiU4mczgn-0ZHRksnE0t0B3w==> .

Google Cloud

 

Google has its own <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001JhRQ4_7u2TFVL3jiwwKukO05P-p6z-q5f3Iq3TFZepztI1BKOqs1tZSl2ZMh2VDfXgjGuho7L-FJ6WnTdGe_HcdINGPHxegS3SyglS9S8Z-PJeUmWxoSdOasCHJC8BjjLPaHo0GvMuGJn967hVJ7Hj0YNHHOGmmZH9uaGlOzOkk=&c=smfNg6GME04gDtpFv291ow50cVONiZZ7UIPNy2dZPnyBOpR1USFGHQ==&ch=Pppfy_SX_ZoVMCk_gOMTDXiQc25K8fzBz1tB_zXQ_iB8IEHlmbDeaQ==>  take on cloud computing, and the Google Ads Developer blog announces, "Starting [yesterday], Ad Exchange users hosting on Google Compute Engine <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001JhRQ4_7u2TFVL3jiwwKukO05P-p6z-q5f3Iq3TFZepztI1BKOqs1tZSl2ZMh2VDfoCRTkLQ_3QXGYjPt8hzFa62UCtYmZ3IVXFgwDtAFZxKxGQDwM7TRcna7cWrN6jfKpvPQHKGVkWVjxcXCNTk-0L9BP_b-829MY6-NXJmxEXqFUzCVok9bj9bRR-8Xf8uRAs6K6Se5gf20-9HbatOmdQ==&c=smfNg6GME04gDtpFv291ow50cVONiZZ7UIPNy2dZPnyBOpR1USFGHQ==&ch=Pppfy_SX_ZoVMCk_gOMTDXiQc25K8fzBz1tB_zXQ_iB8IEHlmbDeaQ==>  will always receive 100 milliseconds for bid request processing and free network transit from Google Cloud Platform to all Ad Exchange trading locations <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001JhRQ4_7u2TFVL3jiwwKukO05P-p6z-q5f3Iq3TFZepztI1BKOqs1tZSl2ZMh2VDfp13DhGm543bi1TEk3JLB93JY6GvpbkLHZqNl3hyHLEYbZ_GB4mGW0ZxiKKnOEvTAeCSIt1HdoWIy3so-zUzr0UmQpKkgoCCDWsXZwt0XiHu767hsv5LrJrdub8QRr432ymWytiptVeVrDJnyW0AggZAstcgSWK-z&c=smfNg6GME04gDtpFv291ow50cVONiZZ7UIPNy2dZPnyBOpR1USFGHQ==&ch=Pppfy_SX_ZoVMCk_gOMTDXiQc25K8fzBz1tB_zXQ_iB8IEHlmbDeaQ==> ." This competes to a degree with Amazon Cloud Services, which provides at least part of the backbone to many an ad tech company. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001JhRQ4_7u2TFVL3jiwwKukO05P-p6z-q5f3Iq3TFZepztI1BKOqs1tZSl2ZMh2VDfaUTUz4wsGTq_XXcdCXeKwVl-EPTgTVziTYL7qsftipJsOWUN7r73DghkJPtHwQk8xpsWypev0vQk_j1u5ZXl3dEO88zoiM9Ec6fboDw_klGhNWy3ORY8_cfAFFjqfzRhzzA85-0ZqlKxwB6uPGn0TPYQ1jdpe4WW7N2Q0MGwp7KbCOQY6bL3jgTDrGhMfMoUpoAcf-4hRpE=&c=smfNg6GME04gDtpFv291ow50cVONiZZ7UIPNy2dZPnyBOpR1USFGHQ==&ch=Pppfy_SX_ZoVMCk_gOMTDXiQc25K8fzBz1tB_zXQ_iB8IEHlmbDeaQ==> . Oracle has a cloud, Salesforce has a cloud, Rubicon has an advertising cloud...You got a cloud?

 

Weather Exchange

 

Weather can help with targeting ads, as AdWeek's Lucia Moses explains: "The Weather Company's Weather FX ad exchange believes that higher- and lower-than-average temperatures, along with precipitation, can help advertisers predict consumer desires." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001JhRQ4_7u2TFVL3jiwwKukO05P-p6z-q5f3Iq3TFZepztI1BKOqs1tZSl2ZMh2VDfm0XvrHqP8jmTkn904i_HPtUBsjimwvYdxE4KYL0MVwV6UYateb1kj-I3wJo_nYka_L6ZJGf5ihK77R4Qox7PVMFgsWhd2E_z3lwkjAk9AsgEfqjwDrhgt0hKsVwlF7h0UrnK0uD89yRxDdVQaU-WuQ4NY7z6p6pR9QssESQtAFnuqX7D7L8MHn-3Q4PyHaIbiecdC5l_E9hdB3MGRB0qEA==&c=smfNg6GME04gDtpFv291ow50cVONiZZ7UIPNy2dZPnyBOpR1USFGHQ==&ch=Pppfy_SX_ZoVMCk_gOMTDXiQc25K8fzBz1tB_zXQ_iB8IEHlmbDeaQ==> . 


Emerging Mobile


Boston-based Jana Mobile is a small startup with incredible global reach. With access to 3.48 billion mobile phones through telecom operators in 102 countries, the company just released a tool that allows mobile marketers to reach emerging market consumers. Jana introduced Marketplace on Wednesday, and the platform's solution to inaccessible mobile markets is simple - give data away for free. Read the rest via Adage <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001JhRQ4_7u2TFVL3jiwwKukO05P-p6z-q5f3Iq3TFZepztI1BKOqs1tZSl2ZMh2VDf29wiZIWvMmkHHq55epn79qshUEmZ9FxtjqjCTtLAbOA-EOitjH2S0_irFepV7j5KszFRLJXx7QkV6fPP_qQcp2i1Rvrd0gY-Wcnc5HJR3smkIySV8euInNAImqX258LT1tlZjujbfD0C2Go1HpnIYmQBGvSJJEgnCuXEGbvDL6kuPE3IHiNwP5kus-bI7wQNPaTatYu12Etnbjs-3zgB7Q==&c=smfNg6GME04gDtpFv291ow50cVONiZZ7UIPNy2dZPnyBOpR1USFGHQ==&ch=Pppfy_SX_ZoVMCk_gOMTDXiQc25K8fzBz1tB_zXQ_iB8IEHlmbDeaQ==> . 


VivaKi Taps Kiip


On Wednesday, Kiip <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001JhRQ4_7u2TFVL3jiwwKukO05P-p6z-q5f3Iq3TFZepztI1BKOqs1tZSl2ZMh2VDf4x5nRI6KJqMjIZvoMtid_PiIW9gsmpGJ27SOj787Z0zcIfnIak6feoWJXok0u472_Y-rqWATNuopCyiPG2j6aaBKutF0k9EHX3QFtbg6XR23Y7cAnJsbH6mNpgSubA97&c=smfNg6GME04gDtpFv291ow50cVONiZZ7UIPNy2dZPnyBOpR1USFGHQ==&ch=Pppfy_SX_ZoVMCk_gOMTDXiQc25K8fzBz1tB_zXQ_iB8IEHlmbDeaQ==>  announced a partnership with Vivaki, the digital solutions arm of Publicis Groupe. With this alliance, VivaKi will use Kipp's "Moments" model to better connect Publicis Groupe agencies and their brands with consumers. The model seeks to engage audiences at significant moments throughout the day across thousands of apps. Get the full story via Kiip <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001JhRQ4_7u2TFVL3jiwwKukO05P-p6z-q5f3Iq3TFZepztI1BKOqs1tZSl2ZMh2VDfINTuu8zKzN46lzYvwc7F6eoPYOQBF20vc0V7IwSm1sVKs54rD1lJ1fKfaDzzyjlDTnHf-5Q7ADe67LTJB3KCBw2GH2TneHnQzsnKXv7YOjKuqkSGl3unUw6SM9q9uY7Foge65Dn8WC3Xaan-vSWE9zeBocV-16M98eUmE5pNUOhNfh2RRjWfG78DTNxmbZ8Iu8WgSuXd3X_mXMPDM0GGC5qrPjTC7fzXPA9bWXBAFLRZHmg8Zf305Q==&c=smfNg6GME04gDtpFv291ow50cVONiZZ7UIPNy2dZPnyBOpR1USFGHQ==&ch=Pppfy_SX_ZoVMCk_gOMTDXiQc25K8fzBz1tB_zXQ_iB8IEHlmbDeaQ==> . 



Customer Acquisition

 

TechCrunch reports some major changes at LaunchBit. According to Elizabeth Yin, co-founder of the email ad network, "Launchbit is pivoting to a customer acquisition platform for SaaS companies." The switch was inspired, in part, by an increase in SaaS companies looking to LaunchBit for sales leads. A partnership with BuySellAds accompanies the transition. Read on <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001JhRQ4_7u2TFVL3jiwwKukO05P-p6z-q5f3Iq3TFZepztI1BKOqs1tZSl2ZMh2VDfRAwju0wQuALiWejMMSrksiLOn4C2xmnSco_1z_KbbaiwoF1T8cE872JxJVFsIvRmOKZLv_IeoOgeDurZgVA_2674480CStaPO2u9rF95qZ8rUfGT3V4raKDlXBqKcfejaJvMOr17Oer_qU2YGIaLM3EI16ML6XzXJZSnvIpNCZoLU22upB74c1XKOhXBFAlAK0rwf-79uuBehpjJkUkVsBZ2OEoUi71OeybNRoX8sxCrmTw1Qx74nw==&c=smfNg6GME04gDtpFv291ow50cVONiZZ7UIPNy2dZPnyBOpR1USFGHQ==&ch=Pppfy_SX_ZoVMCk_gOMTDXiQc25K8fzBz1tB_zXQ_iB8IEHlmbDeaQ==> . 

 

Insight On Interviewing 

 

Entitled "How We Interview... and Why It Sucks," Doug Weaver's piece on The Drift humanizes the exchange between potential colleagues. Suggesting that hiring is not about fact-finding, but rather about uncovering potential, Weaver asks, "If human talent is the killer app in our industry, we do we suck so badly at attracting, evaluating and retaining the best people?" Get some answers <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001JhRQ4_7u2TFVL3jiwwKukO05P-p6z-q5f3Iq3TFZepztI1BKOqs1tZSl2ZMh2VDfgI7SndDER2-pRGnlPdSc9d5awCi3fqASxDEOowfFGbzQf2NeCpIlS4bx5OeUhNT5gfZ5s0TSaETWDtsR3jKfPrwjs6ckg1I4sj4g0PJnU30lun7zISew_aHaP1xEZa9R&c=smfNg6GME04gDtpFv291ow50cVONiZZ7UIPNy2dZPnyBOpR1USFGHQ==&ch=Pppfy_SX_ZoVMCk_gOMTDXiQc25K8fzBz1tB_zXQ_iB8IEHlmbDeaQ==> .

 News Round-Up <http://ih.constantcontact.com/fs116/1102602719219/img/94.jpg>   

Here's today's AdExchanger news round-up... Want it by email?
Sign-up here <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001cB2KchXcoSo86xez3fcp7_HoPGZVGmObAvD5og-RuR8ZWSlNhwihZ65Zx80WdfsL_GveZDepESdSeq8WSAzt4YDTJaub0l7pVy5Zs5oIxDWWr5_Qu4g_y5Cwbgjl87rZNSbIz6eoh-f8I8qbiDKXiLkErLtLWtQGk07seVJbJhFhgtc1wa57SCmGnpYUSvYm&c=KQFCgVrQitiZAZ8gpqj52HocWZ2UJyz86o5L_K8NtAk3BGB_pYUs_w==&ch=b9mhhBKoIfA0RHZm9yCQpIrW7WqroyytXiU5akUB5wfTl9jPugM0bQ==> .

 

Integrating Paid Media


The "social CRM" craze that propelled the acquisitions of Buddy Media and Vitrue is giving way to a new reality, Adaptly President Sean O'Neal writes for Adweek. "Paid, owned and earned are no longer a string of disconnected media tactics, but rather are three legs of the social marketing stool," he writes. Marketer challenges include integrating technology to activate audiences across social platforms. Get the full story <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001cB2KchXcoSo86xez3fcp7_HoPGZVGmObAvD5og-RuR8ZWSlNhwihZ_ht15elYJlBG4h2sEd4VJkzj2fwoQe1UqlDD7Ar6_CIxNA9Tx2MRUYAc9G9Y2lzdPm-qvDkM7z3wjWrz0waNjnpE_f_123kNZ5YlylYYtjv06ORTG_G-SY7XJg3RUFmKdEK49Y0eW4a2CwryN4ts7mMZp7poKw5YyVUykevY9nmJlWL0t8AEYYYEcgMG63tZeaYKBjYAX0QReB9VvCwdoI=&c=KQFCgVrQitiZAZ8gpqj52HocWZ2UJyz86o5L_K8NtAk3BGB_pYUs_w==&ch=b9mhhBKoIfA0RHZm9yCQpIrW7WqroyytXiU5akUB5wfTl9jPugM0bQ==> .


Facebook Failing Marketers


The downplay of organic reach is a case of Facebook "failing marketers," according to Forrester Research analyst Nate Elliott. Brands on Facebook only reach 6% of fans organically and suspect that their followers are falsely generated by "like farms." As brands begin to voice their discontent, marketers are focusing their social efforts on platforms such as Twitter and, ironically, Instagram. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001cB2KchXcoSo86xez3fcp7_HoPGZVGmObAvD5og-RuR8ZWSlNhwihZ_ht15elYJlBWo3Ccz1PQNkP8TVMkITcHxo_KCpZyRjfokTft1sVoeGw6ztSpHytqYZgbFvCqtBfLLZMeRhRosSpcYmZ3eOQNYeKhxAy8eAas8lkEb9z0si5QSh87NViZ4cYQsqagb06pGx2hQs5zVAZ8F7zQ0HTn-92j_kygQJx-gNJEUD1WtsPHkA2eFe6X5sqkghdt_QR&c=KQFCgVrQitiZAZ8gpqj52HocWZ2UJyz86o5L_K8NtAk3BGB_pYUs_w==&ch=b9mhhBKoIfA0RHZm9yCQpIrW7WqroyytXiU5akUB5wfTl9jPugM0bQ==> .


Brewer Brand Engages In Digital Platforms


MillerCoors is investing heavily in online and mobile marketing and, with a planned 50% boost in digital video spending for 2014, has signed content deals with AOL Advertising, Comedy Central, Spotify, the Weather Company and more. The goal, according to the brewer's VP for marketing connections, Jackie Woodard, is for paid, owned and earned media to work together to engage the brand in digital platforms. Ad Age has the story <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001cB2KchXcoSo86xez3fcp7_HoPGZVGmObAvD5og-RuR8ZWSlNhwihZ_ht15elYJlBtWMA906qWHgnuJ1w2W3P01ZIhq-6KofDU6N7k6glhw_Ot1uAR942POuVgdwtC8sUApbJs3FsV7iZ4byjEwzBMQnNsdabZqaPgISdZBv_4TnfVzsU82aq9v9filHT8gtX2q1QoEgiIYaU_tYac5YJ10CSG9giJtZ-CAd9jWUQoSqOrKOGXS1vGG-k1Xbp25EnX3524FhV3S4=&c=KQFCgVrQitiZAZ8gpqj52HocWZ2UJyz86o5L_K8NtAk3BGB_pYUs_w==&ch=b9mhhBKoIfA0RHZm9yCQpIrW7WqroyytXiU5akUB5wfTl9jPugM0bQ==> . 



Yandex Buys KitLocate


Yandex has acqui-hired an eight-person Israeli startup called KitLocate, which specializes in energy-efficient geolocation technology. For consumers, this means KitLocate's algorithms reduce the drain on a phone's battery life by enabling location-based apps to request a mobile device's geographic coordinates less frequently than standard practices. The number of requests depends on a number of factors, including the user's behavior (does he or she change locations frequently?) and the app. Yandex will use KitLocate to improve its own services and provide more location-based results, the company said in a blog post. Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001cB2KchXcoSo86xez3fcp7_HoPGZVGmObAvD5og-RuR8ZWSlNhwihZ_ht15elYJlB_CTTDovL3Pki-mSb4rTRLaDwJlMfIcsAv-ZPAF5O2CKXxydHTLzp_y3upUn3JJuOdpR_T9HF1Re67jWc6w9aQ1F6Wk9-bqmMyehxH57cWoiSiK5bC1fLJYPKYtqZqWOTe-Ycx7fJMqpl_JFbk5_Xds97MoUw4hHV_lqyDHvWQZM=&c=KQFCgVrQitiZAZ8gpqj52HocWZ2UJyz86o5L_K8NtAk3BGB_pYUs_w==&ch=b9mhhBKoIfA0RHZm9yCQpIrW7WqroyytXiU5akUB5wfTl9jPugM0bQ==>  And read MediaPost <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001cB2KchXcoSo86xez3fcp7_HoPGZVGmObAvD5og-RuR8ZWSlNhwihZ_ht15elYJlB3cqjHCcQNsUTgRE4G_OvYgOgtmzkFcTNqIKWJNHBoESf_ZIS33T32eNxCI3Bgawg-niusHYe5Yg_KHFAibi3Y9bhiOa69-LLSk8S0ykFSCFbX6kYk5x_ADR_f61QZfosMpF6N-SMn5unnP-DPMKqpzCSgbsc6aV2JoZ7-QoqdQJLrlcAlDwS7bYpkp9U_wlokPoYxHzP0ZXdQwAnMH4k9dxs-wqV6w5a&c=KQFCgVrQitiZAZ8gpqj52HocWZ2UJyz86o5L_K8NtAk3BGB_pYUs_w==&ch=b9mhhBKoIfA0RHZm9yCQpIrW7WqroyytXiU5akUB5wfTl9jPugM0bQ==> .


Percolate Money




Percolate, a company that helps brands build "interest graphs" to help with content marketing efforts, has raised $24 million in a round led by Sequoia Capital. The Wall Street Journal <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001cB2KchXcoSo86xez3fcp7_HoPGZVGmObAvD5og-RuR8ZWSlNhwihZ_ht15elYJlBwfCxZYyKM3idA9gNHV0ESVSoLq4uWT2brRyT_p4ZjdLcXRisUp47SQDP-tJzlQYIxqhG1oPE4Zhe1ZwmvGTKOHO1qUcbY6e-5ZLnqU5IKoSfHSFfEHjd9DU28a-iNoop9xAneSsKU5H3Ymo27i1oYKymlqxB9z_q7ZQc994_cxxOcs5JWMaHf0MsVmGU_QLe-z7YUq5E8aFPideDyHwQEw==&c=KQFCgVrQitiZAZ8gpqj52HocWZ2UJyz86o5L_K8NtAk3BGB_pYUs_w==&ch=b9mhhBKoIfA0RHZm9yCQpIrW7WqroyytXiU5akUB5wfTl9jPugM0bQ==>  pegs the number of customers at 150, up from the 35 it had when AdExchanger spoke with CEO Noah Brier in 2012. Read that interview <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001cB2KchXcoSo86xez3fcp7_HoPGZVGmObAvD5og-RuR8ZWSlNhwihZ5E-NOuPDcrv6s3oCnPzpgClk-b4f-ia9o6Jn0IKa24Ofq__NIHdW1_sSEOcdox2b_lW8zMLahuAzeHjLgfy008mwPEwFj-ix7OqwCpfr5hXzH49eHQ6fG3ttv9UUWSPDnlrlivmzEPt3PHzrmrDwqDtoCcsWQ4_0hULymz3KDTfsvdr3WrX2v1yRYqJsJBTsu2h6VbxpyMc5KYq8cfvkzZPZR7Vuk2lBE-b5xhiApih&c=KQFCgVrQitiZAZ8gpqj52HocWZ2UJyz86o5L_K8NtAk3BGB_pYUs_w==&ch=b9mhhBKoIfA0RHZm9yCQpIrW7WqroyytXiU5akUB5wfTl9jPugM0bQ==> .

 News Round-Up <http://ih.constantcontact.com/fs116/1102602719219/img/94.jpg>   

Here's today's AdExchanger news round-up... Want it by email?
Sign-up here <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001BPR3pugDqIhL8QENxZHiLJwoNtftDEXCfVqw3WfSunergbdDsx2AR9_7J8Rlvizg7u1cHyumZJEY2bli7qW2RVNZBtA14QwMC2_9-GH66IPwZjHDKR9mS15NlsNbh-Vjh8daxtDORo7Gk5qfbXMWegYp0gwT39QzdbBOs5mjIWpMQFWMhyhhFMx-u3BbSSQu&c=M6KMGQYIED87Smo3mj83OmiedCDiIjwFLAICorV-y6gmBrxTrOogUw==&ch=vdSZnjTqD9FchjiFnrIZZ_gIWEme3-SEt5kOCNonm1fciiTMfjhbvg==> .

 

Revolutionizing TV


Boxfish, a TV data startup, has raised $7 million in hopes of augmenting its product portfolio and expanding internationally. According to GigaOm, "Until now, the idea has been to profile viewers based on where they live and which shows they watch - but Boxfish could make these profiles a lot more granular by allowing companies to keep track of the segments a viewer skips and the topics he or she is interested in, thereby allowing networks to charge more for ads that for once are more hit than miss." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001BPR3pugDqIhL8QENxZHiLJwoNtftDEXCfVqw3WfSunergbdDsx2AR8tgr69d-wfFVBC5ju4yNKWQ07CIFpncTmZonP2vAl7udKiHLN3jPf90p6-k3UML8S6u2tXZ82Iilx_t8qq62-kMSvz9H6qOAhupSpvQExuLHlLu2YL6Z-2YsZUKsYaapSZMJX5CF3GPHg2pJyWmd5hwbrtXjeyf2XKEo9sEhPKDCgVgZuYqjNMITxY0GpbHkBJ0zm8MkgyrXf57cMxLHejs3nV-8wN3pAA-tNUgPe6Hb52m6RyVOpY=&c=M6KMGQYIED87Smo3mj83OmiedCDiIjwFLAICorV-y6gmBrxTrOogUw==&ch=vdSZnjTqD9FchjiFnrIZZ_gIWEme3-SEt5kOCNonm1fciiTMfjhbvg==> .


Don't Fear The Machine


Agencies worried that automation translates to job loss have nothing to fear, advises Nancy Hill, president and CEO of the 4As, in a column for Ad Age. By allowing machines to do the menial tasks, valuable human capital is freed up and operations are more efficient. Furthermore, there is a new level of accuracy with potential for reaching desired audiences more effectively. Animating Cheese


Yahoo is offering up a login ad with animation - or is it an odor? You decide. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001BPR3pugDqIhL8QENxZHiLJwoNtftDEXCfVqw3WfSunergbdDsx2AR8tgr69d-wfFtdA-p-H7k0wWDcIljiQChQbZfZmkbKC6oY1YVJcgHVdOBGdnk4H-nQ13gnZdf7rPYY7fu3RA0lCgp7Fzxq0v2Q7vbgS2JfkUbqhUCBtDqNXP2v2Jm8hixpryTw1mlnZE-nPF-ovjPRg3nX5vwB_kBCI2mbuYiAbL3YVkfwvLvZI=&c=M6KMGQYIED87Smo3mj83OmiedCDiIjwFLAICorV-y6gmBrxTrOogUw==&ch=vdSZnjTqD9FchjiFnrIZZ_gIWEme3-SEt5kOCNonm1fciiTMfjhbvg==>  A steaming grilled cheese sandwich from Kraft is the poster child for Yahoo's new motion ads, which are initially available through the "Billboard Ad on the Yahoo homepage, [the] vertical category homepages, and the Yahoo login page." GIF animations are back!


Beyond Marketing


Maryam Banikarim, senior vice president and CMO of Gannett, takes to CNN Money to explain how her role is not just about marketing. She writes, "My job is to think about how to use the levers of marketing to gain insight into where consumers and the marketplace are heading - all with the goal of growing our business. In the end, it's about generating revenue." Read the rest <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001BPR3pugDqIhL8QENxZHiLJwoNtftDEXCfVqw3WfSunergbdDsx2AR8tgr69d-wfFKDwNfGay2rINLpG5obw80WJByllsXmY57GGLbSr3SySXD_uoMwqfH6Gli6vndtNbgpUPcPVUnW2SvRjlDLvrnwpsRd2F8CXPkyt-aALLHgWBjypWpvmRq8fyLXCmORgWEKPMNRNnq0hk4YSUU7v2smchHHC1HNN2BcJH3q7VoJz3jYl0tkRtXatca8msgyAsdP8HpCgQB6AAtgR-eLwIFA==&c=M6KMGQYIED87Smo3mj83OmiedCDiIjwFLAICorV-y6gmBrxTrOogUw==&ch=vdSZnjTqD9FchjiFnrIZZ_gIWEme3-SEt5kOCNonm1fciiTMfjhbvg==> .


More App Ads


Tapjoy has launched a new platform, nGen, which seeks to drive app engagement and monetize the 95% of mobile app users who don't typically complete in-app purchases. The platform offers a messaging system that helps publishers increase ad relevancy through contextualization. Learn more.

Rumor: Dunnhumby Buying Sociomantic


Business Insider's Nicholas Carlson says that retargeter/DSP/(acronym here) Sociomantic <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001L1xJe74ONPkJFxRYK3sToXToIYnmYlhgCthoX0YcNIAIdgi35-MhI8y2IM86tYrfJScFwL4pwquMb833qfmmh7RlGpxzbyh1_HjAiwDVZr9wQ82yfVy2qSqeUM94A4ebfLqULmvlQ5rjuYRz_ETUtlhrNiJKqCPcDjJGSGN80mA1M-z_av4Hhw==&c=3e4SvaCHhuJPOwyr-FRsQHjss8iaRWGRWOCVpw9VhzWR1azZKEA3qA==&ch=WGc2qq5LwXrCFrGj0bReeHLjMfqY9qDCA5VwQikSg_Epr5rXLjpHuw==>  is being acquired by Dunnhumby, a subsidiary of British retailer Tesco, for $175 million-$200 million - though Carlson says the deal isn't finalized. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001L1xJe74ONPkJFxRYK3sToXToIYnmYlhgCthoX0YcNIAIdgi35-MhI8y2IM86tYrf5PuwfuiCF-VpiG837RxZVnWp_dae2tii0Nto1P-CnckSs0CaEZr4tATSaHxKeNXWbjZhRjqlLAguMUCDX0SOCQ4EyyhpCqyCl23RYWZdbhBod7U9YRjI_BvWe5KpDE-FK1uBDnBXsjyom6-BIvJ6F_K0pw8gwAVbgKugKhdPhGg=&c=3e4SvaCHhuJPOwyr-FRsQHjss8iaRWGRWOCVpw9VhzWR1azZKEA3qA==&ch=WGc2qq5LwXrCFrGj0bReeHLjMfqY9qDCA5VwQikSg_Epr5rXLjpHuw==> . If true, this could be about closing the loop between online and offline data in order to improve targeting of consumers with display ads and the like. In October, Sociomantic issued a release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001L1xJe74ONPkJFxRYK3sToXToIYnmYlhgCthoX0YcNIAIdgi35-MhI6ABZXWbkIoT8-z4cxpVswbPlit9Xq8NHo2KNAVTZ8Owbu4szS1UbBK6LL-RBDQ8ES_vZqnGdEiYdnCQ1QANr7b_bGhKUM-52gvJ3yyN1i1EqhcVXhowdgmb-9Y8qXtW3tutku3jitzbBcR9I_Y9A5am8o35zyfsng==&c=3e4SvaCHhuJPOwyr-FRsQHjss8iaRWGRWOCVpw9VhzWR1azZKEA3qA==&ch=WGc2qq5LwXrCFrGj0bReeHLjMfqY9qDCA5VwQikSg_Epr5rXLjpHuw==>  about improving its CRM capabilities.


Facebook Video, Finally


Facebook announced long ago that it would introduce video ads and, according to a blog post, that vision has finally come to fruition. The social site is using Targeted Gross Ratings points for delivery, Nielsen OCR for measurement and Ace Metrix to vet the videos for quality so users aren't bombarded by irrelevant ads. The videos will autoplay without sound, but if clicked on by the user the video expands and sound starts playing. Read the post <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001L1xJe74ONPkJFxRYK3sToXToIYnmYlhgCthoX0YcNIAIdgi35-MhI8y2IM86tYrfyGA6jpxO8QfL-ukmLxyltMxQdn8cEM4soQfYf5zZVDS0uaGYyoSyQbQsk_XbOLZO9wUToiyNDX_-IyJp8G7erXTceWIkfWbifSEyo0cKT-algf-LHlfqftdtgeWfjox4oBxt71FDn7apzFkOeBlgRft2RRCsoyta4OohGhRjGBU=&c=3e4SvaCHhuJPOwyr-FRsQHjss8iaRWGRWOCVpw9VhzWR1azZKEA3qA==&ch=WGc2qq5LwXrCFrGj0bReeHLjMfqY9qDCA5VwQikSg_Epr5rXLjpHuw==> . And more from Inside Facebook <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001L1xJe74ONPkJFxRYK3sToXToIYnmYlhgCthoX0YcNIAIdgi35-MhI8y2IM86tYrfu_R-1VXtkQTirDQ9YJ0m5diRPmR4B6pF7cfsPrDCthmkbxhH09WZJ0GalMLZR-QUELfzH6oIZbWSYGPMJYqxPPZ7l9lUE3IRoN0nsYVzj46BzefG0KTF5jI8gjDHNk5d4ghtKb-7OlV4-r2-8jfED6GloeQ1Go-1rUI2xTYFag_LhzbMHMGA8bePfTW77gdiF3ExwvvXzNMxQBm4yRZ4Mjd8ItxFKOh-&c=3e4SvaCHhuJPOwyr-FRsQHjss8iaRWGRWOCVpw9VhzWR1azZKEA3qA==&ch=WGc2qq5LwXrCFrGj0bReeHLjMfqY9qDCA5VwQikSg_Epr5rXLjpHuw==> .


iAd Update


Apple appears to have included a new functionality in iOS 7.1 that helps app developers measure the effectiveness of its iAd platform. The new functionality is not mentioned in Apple's "What's New in iOS" summary, but the new API code <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001L1xJe74ONPkJFxRYK3sToXToIYnmYlhgCthoX0YcNIAIdgi35-MhI8y2IM86tYrfcpUrJ-TujRzqwn1ndnOiuiKDZ5wyFqyy6hvyPEykI_vBWt-Sv7bJg29pyP8VhC-wjAbO0WcRUZjJIph23aYWjAKI9lVT9F8UfBiPMg0mfC3Twpis9tF9sDFCHBlYWu3ybjRvTceEuacrFl_KUBpR8A4Xm881hD7m4lqpVs9LE4o-MmoevyUtQMBgrgg21xcjG23FEE_Gbv4=&c=3e4SvaCHhuJPOwyr-FRsQHjss8iaRWGRWOCVpw9VhzWR1azZKEA3qA==&ch=WGc2qq5LwXrCFrGj0bReeHLjMfqY9qDCA5VwQikSg_Epr5rXLjpHuw==>  indicates a change, said HasOffers, which flagged the update. "Based on our interpretation, we believe this method will provide insight into whether a user engaged (impression or click) with an ad from iAd, in specific, prior to installing the app," writes HasOffers in a blog post. No word yet from Apple confirming the change. Read the post <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001L1xJe74ONPkJFxRYK3sToXToIYnmYlhgCthoX0YcNIAIdgi35-MhI8y2IM86tYrf-MI9qaZv_9GQWHfLepsUf0HKp0wFltlsanpA_01YBqEVuaKki0iMaTuYvIussB1M0xqsA2uBdZRQwvmQXhcBUxO1MpGHyZW-DiNlYk4OJzYjUNpKhVmMkid40nfNpyFVXBhHRKrZpBi5pQLntsmVtHinpHp9TayC&c=3e4SvaCHhuJPOwyr-FRsQHjss8iaRWGRWOCVpw9VhzWR1azZKEA3qA==&ch=WGc2qq5LwXrCFrGj0bReeHLjMfqY9qDCA5VwQikSg_Epr5rXLjpHuw==> .


Extending Experience


Twitter continues to take baby steps with its Promoted Accounts products. TechCrunch's Ingrid Lunden reports that Twitter will be inserting a "Promoted Tweet" in your Desktop timeline soon. She writes, "It's part of Twitter's bigger push to have more parity between the mobile and desktop experiences - a theme that has also been highlighted with redesigns on the desktop to look more like the mobile product." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001L1xJe74ONPkJFxRYK3sToXToIYnmYlhgCthoX0YcNIAIdgi35-MhI8y2IM86tYrfZQwE4sYz5I2MJ0MvyG6a406FJ4_FvXhn8Ui8M1IktDZy95xhCuQpq9T6V9d8BgbA_0BChSnH0PiWiRjvQtVX-rbFOO2AqugvNOKw22XRmAVArNljnPc67Sz6WRb1gWNRLPQsRXb7hG0hiGlZaydcbcuI-6-fNB7ThYQlg8u4PH3JvuK9nxdkvN9kImO0_5g2Oie6Wf5EXgD8g-8ehxNLVooC6vv0zqMB&c=3e4SvaCHhuJPOwyr-FRsQHjss8iaRWGRWOCVpw9VhzWR1azZKEA3qA==&ch=WGc2qq5LwXrCFrGj0bReeHLjMfqY9qDCA5VwQikSg_Epr5rXLjpHuw==> .


Loosening The Grip


Emarketer sees the mobile freight train headed Google's way and that its search revenues will take a hit in the future as users move from desktop to mobile. In a blog post, eMarketer says, "Desktop search ad spending will drop $1.4 billion this year, a decrease of 9.4% from 2013, while mobile search will increase 82.3% year over year." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001L1xJe74ONPkJFxRYK3sToXToIYnmYlhgCthoX0YcNIAIdgi35-MhI8y2IM86tYrf4PqZjyMpHAzymitd_-_kVB2jy1FLhHfDuFCukGd6-JZIxdsWmTR0UR2bZDwON5rIUDB2-pXLRGQECB0NO5mZAARB5XNfPBZf7LW1mhvr9lPwe27ac9SFCUcMEg4SK5FhHb_6ajuK1TWDkN1edTehpyySyvDBsLcxFKNtL8gfMWF4xt4ysGoreVfPGGo5YHlR6JUvL1jXWcsSBBSheBpPww==&c=3e4SvaCHhuJPOwyr-FRsQHjss8iaRWGRWOCVpw9VhzWR1azZKEA3qA==&ch=WGc2qq5LwXrCFrGj0bReeHLjMfqY9qDCA5VwQikSg_Epr5rXLjpHuw==> . This is the same challenge all publishers have with monetizing in mobile. It's not like the old days of the desktop.

 News Round-Up <http://ih.constantcontact.com/fs116/1102602719219/img/94.jpg>   

Here's today's AdExchanger news round-up... Want it by email?
Sign-up here <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001rjzsC9dYnCRKmjvkui3A5FvkIgLE2ca9aFeHR5xNTraJI7htI9GRtOJwQ4ob9LpB1h6IxXJAkSurvRKhp5kysHu6cy-eqx8hSLS4QSRvwj9R2T1Dmn3TEQIkEgJfpPxniWApM1zN-BJVgOUsIcHf__G_ZWfBl4BU_t3mIzIP5wpLox4XHF2nsyzUDyLMo5J-&c=S0BBZlPirDwTiZXlxo5mxLBbaV9hoysMY3hcpZc7o5IxDbcuzgU9jg==&ch=gT-ptjH4ZulxYNGRMCgpt6Ci150Ipquu85JyICXGd4N2ZG4Tq05JJA==> .

 

Testing Cross Channel


Google is testing a new cross-device targeting option with advertisers that doesn't rely on cookies, but rather on brand sites with more than 100,000 visitors, AdAge reports. Google drops a tag on the brand's site which can then be matched across devices. "We're always running experiments with our agency partners. This small trial started last year, testing a way for marketers to reach their customers across devices using their own customer data," said a Google spokesperson. Read on <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001rjzsC9dYnCRKmjvkui3A5FvkIgLE2ca9aFeHR5xNTraJI7htI9GRtJHiBH1elXF892Lqt_fMs7udvJwZfeE7busXuaNNt3ry2fXEAjCD1VkgFDjl27Olt15HMBdV7k6A79SXkQzKblyW8RtdwsshigD4vZkJVQzhmJyWs4vfVu3Nz3hFeFhnSeWnf605Eh4ciUeQmmNqxsDc-f36dMI2eYVn8ch2Evu6wdJ9qIakmWh0BcP6ZDCQClaI40jH8sx9naI1dzrzYKUESp1GPo3FdA==&c=S0BBZlPirDwTiZXlxo5mxLBbaV9hoysMY3hcpZc7o5IxDbcuzgU9jg==&ch=gT-ptjH4ZulxYNGRMCgpt6Ci150Ipquu85JyICXGd4N2ZG4Tq05JJA==> .


IPO King


Mobile game developer, King.com, looks to raise up to $532.8 million in its IPO, according to The New York Times. That puts the company's valuation at $7.6 billion, with a lot of that success owed to the franchise's widely popular Candy Crush Saga game. The company's closest competitor, Zynga, has struggled since its IPO in 2011. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001rjzsC9dYnCRKmjvkui3A5FvkIgLE2ca9aFeHR5xNTraJI7htI9GRtJHiBH1elXF89XxdHCn2tUzVw80oA4zd3_8BbZE23QnF51fXypB86BgLS57Ma6W4kwUfQjOWRZlA0_ouS0OechALej9ypFPiJDN3v2Y5AOjgPMfjMoFyQ91szqgeYWZjQtc_eQ17ktfNkIvWlPPGenIvoV6QhlglGO2zgEM3gvM7wHb3E2KTYWOv9ycTyoo_iWx87NLmdAwXQpLxHsR-avt_0ieoGyUKjqWs8eu-vWMV&c=S0BBZlPirDwTiZXlxo5mxLBbaV9hoysMY3hcpZc7o5IxDbcuzgU9jg==&ch=gT-ptjH4ZulxYNGRMCgpt6Ci150Ipquu85JyICXGd4N2ZG4Tq05JJA==> .


Track Block


Adblock Plus now blocks 8,600 trackers, which allow advertisers to target users across the web. The company is known for its popular browser extension that blocks ads from 90% of advertisers (it claims 10% of advertisers are on its whitelist). "We don't think all tracking is bad - it can actually be useful if done transparently; but we do think you should have a robust block list if you want to get rid of it," Adblock Plus's CEO and co-founder, Till Faida, told TechCrunch. Read the rest <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001rjzsC9dYnCRKmjvkui3A5FvkIgLE2ca9aFeHR5xNTraJI7htI9GRtJHiBH1elXF8D3o3qqzy1Vy1r-kMz3KVzmXGlxihtX5oFI_AbYpgDwZm5QpKoOxTgdV1EZ6vNrEJAnBK1tJsqRPupm1fjBCJbvAAs9HbgJBBY3H602kBby_SaFyuEIHXpp9hMN07Ssbll0mbMmCeLThpPKw_CRLskw==&c=S0BBZlPirDwTiZXlxo5mxLBbaV9hoysMY3hcpZc7o5IxDbcuzgU9jg==&ch=gT-ptjH4ZulxYNGRMCgpt6Ci150Ipquu85JyICXGd4N2ZG4Tq05JJA==> .


Tweaking Twitter


Twitter is beta testing a click-to-call button, in a play to connect to local ad markets. By modifying the app, Twitter hopes to "generate leads, drive app download, collect consumer's email addresses and induce incoming calls from customers," VP of global online sales Richard Alfonsi told Digiday. Services such as Google Maps and Yelp already employ a similar feature, one that connects users directly to advertisers, but the decision for Twitter comes in the wake of a decrease in ad revenue at the end of last year. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001rjzsC9dYnCRKmjvkui3A5FvkIgLE2ca9aFeHR5xNTraJI7htI9GRtJHiBH1elXF8PHQCNHdkQb5uTHq4liI9Td4hUWn25fTe1WQByIT2834hPOHBT8hW8QHrBneHpFT2sgVvxxuEXu8Oa-PEw_RlMwhVQIpnJktsyWBu_tYAoo2VBwL9Cv2cGH1xQfKNh8Wbgcz6r1CEeOYNJdz2vgOLT-hhpCOBvXZRIqb5tunH-mo4R7y7U3XgZ35MHHjJQctFSLW4-07kiWM6SfZflY_7_w==&c=S0BBZlPirDwTiZXlxo5mxLBbaV9hoysMY3hcpZc7o5IxDbcuzgU9jg==&ch=gT-ptjH4ZulxYNGRMCgpt6Ci150Ipquu85JyICXGd4N2ZG4Tq05JJA==> .


The Content Strategy


Yahoo's CMO Kathy Savitt hopes the company's focus on content will pay off in the long run as more sites are redesigned for the modern user. Examples include Yahoo's food and tech sites, which reflect this new "digital magazine idea" that Savitt explained to Adweek. Although Marissa Mayer has made leaps and bounds in hiring and mobile development, ad revenues remain elusive. Read the rest <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001rjzsC9dYnCRKmjvkui3A5FvkIgLE2ca9aFeHR5xNTraJI7htI9GRtJHiBH1elXF8YIeuPbqtMNCG-Ffs8LMX0T24-wsGrro2ykN7HMp92Jd36mPm9UxBnUTSKrBfUDKFpbyBAr9uIy275Iwq6lKNSRJDj2eXqdd-nSgwA2bp41zfdGE-3DheMbTIoIAfgtoo-v4wYqxsPT57SWJ06qjiilxIy8QkiSYqv2dVVMIXSjk1I0175tB4_IX3gbEFM9QAld-oGKVhELEl53Z7o0fOEg==&c=S0BBZlPirDwTiZXlxo5mxLBbaV9hoysMY3hcpZc7o5IxDbcuzgU9jg==&ch=gT-ptjH4ZulxYNGRMCgpt6Ci150Ipquu85JyICXGd4N2ZG4Tq05JJA==> .

Mobile Marketing In China


Mobile usage in China may be soaring, but that doesn't necessarily bode well for all app developers, according to new Forrester research. Analyst Xiaofeng Wang found that mobile users in China prefer social and messaging apps that are light on data, due to slow speeds and poor infrastructure. A suggestion is for marketers to work with well established messaging and social apps that have a large user base. Read the release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001rjzsC9dYnCRKmjvkui3A5FvkIgLE2ca9aFeHR5xNTraJI7htI9GRtJHiBH1elXF8_t65KUShUXWLyIJ6fd3jj31WXFaO4_UG3miOli2cwaFY2xCZNOFDLUIwHuKbdA2xRDkPG75Idu6pt7oY2A1bgHPfLTKqI6cxmxzalo10B1caamE20W27ps6MwKv3u9alPOUuoyYqUDeu2dcjZKXqaXLI2nLj_1kO-IYFvVa9M1uGmRT_01TkHzsm05VhFEq_8Hw2394JZz6vIoEqsBcBgBINcLyErJAwkKqV98kBEVq5vkNIzndGGg_NyHo613NVB2aEq7LqEywJvkCe1Q62Pw==&c=S0BBZlPirDwTiZXlxo5mxLBbaV9hoysMY3hcpZc7o5IxDbcuzgU9jg==&ch=gT-ptjH4ZulxYNGRMCgpt6Ci150Ipquu85JyICXGd4N2ZG4Tq05JJA==> .
