 News Round-Up <http://ih.constantcontact.com/fs116/1102602719219/img/94.jpg>   

Here's today's AdExchanger news round-up... Want it by email?
Sign-up here <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001lXN-inW7CM-O7Ni1U4wGN5zNnJHmERmUPmxuEn_CRUyIqYcdr_yjGS4vG8WyIE52XSb1B-DD_nGaob6AyXnxyMO1XTD2bbHhR2-vSW5YVo4ESb_cxnL9L2ZXh7R6rAeeVAzJB8is6V5PS-E4DNs4PBfPnlXTRuNahU7_JbiEJH2wKmdvmt1vquNLqvKoR00n&c=NAGMrzXQybv8_HzhkW8IYEpmJRrkH7FcXJIkOjkdOe2mRT29UksF4g==&ch=RxsbacJfBXrEC4sUJlWvO94-382fQjmMMc4iL6LMg1D4GDwDS3UYOw==> .

 

Standardizing Ads


The IAB is seeking comment on an update of its "Digital Video In-Stream Ad Metric Definitions." New metrics include "Ad expand/collapse" and the ever-popular "Skip," which "describes when a user intentionally skips a linear video ad by clicking a button or other control mechanism." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001lXN-inW7CM-O7Ni1U4wGN5zNnJHmERmUPmxuEn_CRUyIqYcdr_yjGdzfn6JlLEHfeGCCho8ko068fXb7H1kaWfFN-E3SUSnm9tyzF8TC3mdJlTiUqYrc0X1yVm_mcImWBCGRLUfm1HhNECvubT6e3wsMQPSFY6Hqk3j2NI7ot9h1xigVpJsntq5WCI51Z2Jx_xQRJj-xwFG9oKNWlZBAau6MZdkT0DGREFYyiEEXcSGIuY0ppnoWO4wJ1QBuWVcNJH-l0vybxEH2TlNSe3XHSV19UA73pGQg&c=NAGMrzXQybv8_HzhkW8IYEpmJRrkH7FcXJIkOjkdOe2mRT29UksF4g==&ch=RxsbacJfBXrEC4sUJlWvO94-382fQjmMMc4iL6LMg1D4GDwDS3UYOw==> . Download the definitions <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001lXN-inW7CM-O7Ni1U4wGN5zNnJHmERmUPmxuEn_CRUyIqYcdr_yjGdzfn6JlLEHfxaPOiqQbFWOTHbQPbSGeBlQSeLRY16UWzhT_VW4Sf_17fRALgJpxdthJOK5tcvnUhEKKzTH4WJ1fSG5fmP4AYUa9zKqW99XZC5VjRm-uXL4XJ_BohfRioAZ0N48pG_7B&c=NAGMrzXQybv8_HzhkW8IYEpmJRrkH7FcXJIkOjkdOe2mRT29UksF4g==&ch=RxsbacJfBXrEC4sUJlWvO94-382fQjmMMc4iL6LMg1D4GDwDS3UYOw==> . The hope is that standardization of video ads leads to increased efficiency.


Wheat Tech


In Ad Age, Mixpo CEO Jeff Lanctot takes a look at what he sees as a crowded field in ad tech in an op-ed. He advises the various silos of the ad ecosystem on how to select the ad tech wheat from the chaff. For marketers, he writes, "Your job will continue to get harder, and the industry more complicated. Your challenge is to understand what's a commodity and what's an innovation." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001lXN-inW7CM-O7Ni1U4wGN5zNnJHmERmUPmxuEn_CRUyIqYcdr_yjGdzfn6JlLEHf3c1P2h_naZY7dP4W7S41A5gFmX2gDHrRd6qGoa8WDHXnZVE7QxjDGfS8iQg7H_Fivrr2KBgMqqzFl9lUPGD6CpYxERPCOuYtewUusf5dclb0lDiuTdW0oi-n7MFPK5xOsXklD9StymPpIfESKGFF_SbjEtyIdb_UTr5Opx1HnOg=&c=NAGMrzXQybv8_HzhkW8IYEpmJRrkH7FcXJIkOjkdOe2mRT29UksF4g==&ch=RxsbacJfBXrEC4sUJlWvO94-382fQjmMMc4iL6LMg1D4GDwDS3UYOw==> .


TV And Video Are Not Colliding


Addressable TV company Visible World's blog takes last week's <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001lXN-inW7CM-O7Ni1U4wGN5zNnJHmERmUPmxuEn_CRUyIqYcdr_yjGdzfn6JlLEHf1z9Cl_Hba4UpFvlWDcfN9vFt6QIiNPQ2DK0KI8pL12ZdhHIk8I-nt_DOSbz5m5PhBI6FYSLT_S1JPXkIl-pZyqrFyCw94s_o9P-EZCAyIItiqNm-Ru7ezpZnA_yfxh3Ow1gO0PWSVSkniWYUBs9D66jZwSoj1NxmnI4tqAcpIIU=&c=NAGMrzXQybv8_HzhkW8IYEpmJRrkH7FcXJIkOjkdOe2mRT29UksF4g==&ch=RxsbacJfBXrEC4sUJlWvO94-382fQjmMMc4iL6LMg1D4GDwDS3UYOw==>  AdExchanger comic to task. The author writes, "As TV and web video become increasingly similar and entangled, there's no reason to fear a collision and every reason to work towards a smooth blending of the two. Wouldn't we all prefer to have the above cartoon end with a bigger, faster, more maneuverable truck labeled 'Video'?" Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001lXN-inW7CM-O7Ni1U4wGN5zNnJHmERmUPmxuEn_CRUyIqYcdr_yjGdzfn6JlLEHfFcmAkSHE5EgonNSUHGUY8z03ICtSGtPDCaGCnCYfebIoX0fY-TRQ0RDccY7H5la9H1t5hlBJkQeDynaCvxcF7VfF3Ek_hMOC2S83dH8q7B7ZuvtaN39skz7CsOG-fKTNPYVxGT_0g7PAqF1GHi7nCdnpjDlW9oPF5e1rMyd71z5AEn5zpvokOA==&c=NAGMrzXQybv8_HzhkW8IYEpmJRrkH7FcXJIkOjkdOe2mRT29UksF4g==&ch=RxsbacJfBXrEC4sUJlWvO94-382fQjmMMc4iL6LMg1D4GDwDS3UYOw==> .


Fire Away


Appsfire is getting into the mobile native ad business with its new service called Sashimi Ads. Mmmm. The premise, like other companies doing native, is to blend ads in seamlessly with content on multiple platforms. According to the blog post, some highlights to this new service are automation and targeting. Read the post <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001lXN-inW7CM-O7Ni1U4wGN5zNnJHmERmUPmxuEn_CRUyIqYcdr_yjGdzfn6JlLEHfTRdvU-sTDvjrns8yohQoiqLjWjKE0NyhMkE-hQkVFQvlldTZfzWvuGX1kw4c5-haKO9VG95n-ygeBRuUFnjI-ErM1uHhSGF6VN2Gt-nek_zX-ykntM8Vh06et4_2-EIaU_WVZ8Ik-m1mUBf8FNHlCCiegTg4FALooYSAREdtDVjvOL-pFJimDUTUrmcOYOLTAKi6ZtfjoSE=&c=NAGMrzXQybv8_HzhkW8IYEpmJRrkH7FcXJIkOjkdOe2mRT29UksF4g==&ch=RxsbacJfBXrEC4sUJlWvO94-382fQjmMMc4iL6LMg1D4GDwDS3UYOw==> .


Cross-Channel Complexities


Ecommerce cloud company ChannelAdvisor launched a new digital marketing platform to guide retailers and manufacturers through the complexities of marketing products online. According to VP Link Walls (fav name!), "we wanted to bring together some of the disparate parts of our platform in one place for our customers, whether it's understanding how they're doing on Google Shopping or how they're doing on mobile vs. desktop or Pinterest." One of Google Shopping's early launch partners, Walls told AdExchanger that Channel Advisor is tackling the problem of applying inventory and product data into advertising media. Read the release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001lXN-inW7CM-O7Ni1U4wGN5zNnJHmERmUPmxuEn_CRUyIqYcdr_yjGdzfn6JlLEHf5a4ma4VkvLc670e4EFs2mzRyJBrU1E3B8Ur-UjQEtBKKwDHMO2nPwvYo9DeWDLJyLlspZRGxuyufNdcFufWDt0np1b7ehv7O1N32jTYX_frjMht7fON-Hk43Suxe-bMNMUwkCzjncPTKOi1q8ssUYX9rB8MPuZc3FByksy86sllEvyeAG4ruYj3mWS26yhWWeBVxeQKztsJhsmFWFLPTtveNBnhsma5wYcMEUwpJCg25YSQYDMIBOF9CJXTg483mHYB2FT89WjLDjW0cmfx-lw==&c=NAGMrzXQybv8_HzhkW8IYEpmJRrkH7FcXJIkOjkdOe2mRT29UksF4g==&ch=RxsbacJfBXrEC4sUJlWvO94-382fQjmMMc4iL6LMg1D4GDwDS3UYOw==> .

 News Round-Up <http://ih.constantcontact.com/fs116/1102602719219/img/94.jpg>   

Here's today's AdExchanger news round-up... Want it by email?
Sign-up here <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001dm6dT119uSpgUc4GaOouZUK1CdRPL4viwhKBjomGVHtOtlc0H6jbByEH9z1dDSNschxDs_7GTzGi8z7D_PNwMV9kH3RrQ4wn3spvXHDjdRyrtN3g5HXLSSxH_c5cnFyPKPkxgxzlYcd1fzFTKP3S8JD0WRLizoaBjUOTvND5AKNirWh_ChfxO8RY2cGoOqD8&c=E6ByEsBDpav-k2kyReRlWaIkBWYT7ityNKBXK5GhwhEZ2U3jcQH2AQ==&ch=0p8jg-mJh-Gi6TtHwCsqEvazc05IXGHQmEUMsT0X6cw06MWJcJOXEw==> .

 

Performance IPO


Is it another programmatic IPO? Performance marketing company Matomy has decided it's ready for an initial public offering and will seek to raise $100 million on the London Stock Exchange, according to the FT. The Israel-based company "generated revenues of $194m in 2013, up from $120m in 2012 and $107m in 2011," according to the FT, which compares Matomy to Criteo and Rocket Fuel. Read more (subscription) <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001dm6dT119uSpgUc4GaOouZUK1CdRPL4viwhKBjomGVHtOtlc0H6jbBzWQXFfWw6IHGawuV1iYdvSUMz88RdhaOHz3nItAnNLU1n6af4Pgcghmeu1HKOd1fFRopP6uRUsyTu-oBiC0XnfFcc1yJouaSP7sgGQxdv0sN6wlWoSDQyMUcsCwnX0mZ1epp_QDmy8ugQezlOB_HxbaGAqViCNCFpzTitkOVEh0NbsE7x7AtdeDJcd-xzv9Ug==&c=E6ByEsBDpav-k2kyReRlWaIkBWYT7ityNKBXK5GhwhEZ2U3jcQH2AQ==&ch=0p8jg-mJh-Gi6TtHwCsqEvazc05IXGHQmEUMsT0X6cw06MWJcJOXEw==> . Globes says <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001dm6dT119uSpgUc4GaOouZUK1CdRPL4viwhKBjomGVHtOtlc0H6jbBzWQXFfWw6IHGIisA3ygtHYMYzLEkQ7QuZGO6tFh76FeT6wmpAXrbrsZmDaO5QV-KC8q5IDvUFxv9kfG-uNtrvoXXZPlTW0TtACAKnhxZRCp1DXUidU-gjXd_AtVp2cWktYBVjzdfrtEnsNBh-KhmWePCaKGqljiPoEDcqejiQy59hGsLp385CcsBR0f8yKBPy4i4gVpXjGxme-1n-dDSHE=&c=E6ByEsBDpav-k2kyReRlWaIkBWYT7ityNKBXK5GhwhEZ2U3jcQH2AQ==&ch=0p8jg-mJh-Gi6TtHwCsqEvazc05IXGHQmEUMsT0X6cw06MWJcJOXEw==>  Matomy will be worth around $500 million after the offering.


Back To Print


Print revenues are declining rapidly, but that isn't stopping some online publishers from launching magazines (or relaunching <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001dm6dT119uSpgUc4GaOouZUK1CdRPL4viwhKBjomGVHtOtlc0H6jbBzWQXFfWw6IH9CaVVPytMR1BmgCP5EEpZNikGghXs3Vpp3I-Cu4Hv1zhDakXs57u4klfzqAmijLWzTaxgecG4JlhbqoWTJJROXASvPLSj4jnElM6H47WGYXkgNCiz10WDFjTOvwAzpkQ1xxuFnRUXtq149beMeFQiJYvIbn15fn5V2Ol5ZbZc3_KqKf6BLLMKF8ZMsL86NpAS5BTaNL6ifU=&c=E6ByEsBDpav-k2kyReRlWaIkBWYT7ityNKBXK5GhwhEZ2U3jcQH2AQ==&ch=0p8jg-mJh-Gi6TtHwCsqEvazc05IXGHQmEUMsT0X6cw06MWJcJOXEw==> , if you're Newsweek). As Digiday reports, Politico, Pitchfork and Pando all plan on launching premium magazines with low subscription numbers and high prices. "Having a subscription-based magazine made for a specific audience is a sensible, almost predictably boring business," said Paul Carr, investigations editor for Pando. "In pure economic terms, selling a magazine like this is no more of risk than making t-shirts." Read on <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001dm6dT119uSpgUc4GaOouZUK1CdRPL4viwhKBjomGVHtOtlc0H6jbBzWQXFfWw6IHqM2kTwwuZoXzTwx6XEiuakw40xsLilREYZoM_BiyBs-BnItbywTWdZLAV0nP-1ulXAsZfngMkiwf3KQgdeBFxxCdUhcn1EgAThpxgKZoIi-VKPLRHBSjjNJRelyxj0GLSID2H4tWDwmBS4n5MLP_NSvkExsQmKo5ae4Lg5akROEcXAsBoq6qnQ==&c=E6ByEsBDpav-k2kyReRlWaIkBWYT7ityNKBXK5GhwhEZ2U3jcQH2AQ==&ch=0p8jg-mJh-Gi6TtHwCsqEvazc05IXGHQmEUMsT0X6cw06MWJcJOXEw==> .


Still More Native


The Wall Street Journal is the next mainstream publication to try out native advertising, according to a press release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001dm6dT119uSpgUc4GaOouZUK1CdRPL4viwhKBjomGVHtOtlc0H6jbBzWQXFfWw6IHpmGaqUrUzuaQbXYck9CCLDn5mEezL1NSRQFszOwEtNQVE35TnsUVlicmVLdCHtqNs3s1dRRtfCzAKus5FO4ODVG7RD-_cQ68QjTr2V9b2kgZvYyS6_QoTc3OjjXcKPORmPP2VYxVAG-DlPcp_kYjYEEBWcuQciDUrZAImY6gM592nZw8WJ4pLQgedMB3bHa70l-c17zXHqVotmrwX1v_tdhcTi8cy8ZeAwHMcVrOWvQn0LdIDsRdfXmaHp0A5wte1QgiUUQKdcWWGZw0M_Tslg==&c=E6ByEsBDpav-k2kyReRlWaIkBWYT7ityNKBXK5GhwhEZ2U3jcQH2AQ==&ch=0p8jg-mJh-Gi6TtHwCsqEvazc05IXGHQmEUMsT0X6cw06MWJcJOXEw==> . The sponsored content will be created through WSJ Custom Studios and will be clearly differentiated from editorial content, according to the publisher. "Smart brands are creating compelling stories. They are not getting into the news business, but are getting into the storytelling business," said SVP Raju Narisetti of News Corp in a Q <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001dm6dT119uSpgUc4GaOouZUK1CdRPL4viwhKBjomGVHtOtlc0H6jbBzWQXFfWw6IHxw1hFgE0rv5mSEjflc6aYKGjn6D_swVJ53jL1RJcTQ6mgml0ga7ZLrRDw634vGpb4ET40oCUVhzPM136d2U5tytaUgoI3vpSpzv8CNfecVbXuTfpQ_w4Lbfcc54Z9bQvpdY9Rspui6qF90NZk8_wpftJHQ4LwBYsH5zt_-imsP-r4acRbDxYxjFfwr5y7FMi&c=E6ByEsBDpav-k2kyReRlWaIkBWYT7ityNKBXK5GhwhEZ2U3jcQH2AQ==&ch=0p8jg-mJh-Gi6TtHwCsqEvazc05IXGHQmEUMsT0X6cw06MWJcJOXEw==> &A on the Dow Jones site.


Advertisers Buying Ad Tech


Priceline Group has acquired Israel-based ad targeting startup Qlika, according to Re/code, for around $3 million. This move will help Priceline focus its online travel ad campaigns in local markets. Read the rest <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001dm6dT119uSpgUc4GaOouZUK1CdRPL4viwhKBjomGVHtOtlc0H6jbBzWQXFfWw6IHdHeY0j6HH4TKvL3Va8pRrNmzAgWlKx3fcYFrPF_sSZj_ZmeovJj8dtB1nIz8jwGylfN8Xwv2-QyWnHfpiw3metjZU0MdUMqd64KNpI3hxE_EaR1fK_a7D8eP_BXV_HLBw7YfA4sGGWZI7nZwgl8gh3SZPwJmvjprms7RL05mT17jgN16pIaldz4EiowhTwDQ0qRCfktHqlywfJYfM4Jn9DXA9yW6lSfE&c=E6ByEsBDpav-k2kyReRlWaIkBWYT7ityNKBXK5GhwhEZ2U3jcQH2AQ==&ch=0p8jg-mJh-Gi6TtHwCsqEvazc05IXGHQmEUMsT0X6cw06MWJcJOXEw==> .


Digital Age Branding


Subway's chief marketing officer, Tony Pace, offers some marketing insights to The Wall Street Journal. He recommends marketers stay creative, balance the long and short term and learn how to turn data into insights. "Everybody is chasing the new technologies all the time, but you have to remember that the long-established benchmarks of marketing remain the same despite the fact the channels are different," Pace said. Read more (subscription) <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001dm6dT119uSpgUc4GaOouZUK1CdRPL4viwhKBjomGVHtOtlc0H6jbBzWQXFfWw6IHoz4msLRNMTd0DcYiFw5zHmS6aUZavcLWRFbjGNzaEEBOIWrCaBT-cC-MZuDN3BEPkISWldXA9DJfT6idv5TggLO36iRsUGw6KqA1l0xmF495Mq8ALjmHKea3oFxW67AIDTo1RLtO1gqezZYVGopBtOdevTAKgKySSyEm671B7ESLWvd1aNT2Wv0s9UIJBgic&c=E6ByEsBDpav-k2kyReRlWaIkBWYT7ityNKBXK5GhwhEZ2U3jcQH2AQ==&ch=0p8jg-mJh-Gi6TtHwCsqEvazc05IXGHQmEUMsT0X6cw06MWJcJOXEw==> .

Dial Up The Frequency


According to Acxiom, less is not necessarily more with online display ads. A white paper finds people who see a display ad fewer than 10 times are unlikely to be influenced to purchase. There are also some harsh words here for ad tech intermediaries. "It's not necessary to use any advertising technology other than what the publisher provides to get a great return on advertising. All the campaigns we looked at were run using direct buys from publishers sold at normal rates. No remnant inventory. The difference was that the ads were shown only to people identified by Acxiom and uploaded to the publisher." More here <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001dm6dT119uSpgUc4GaOouZUK1CdRPL4viwhKBjomGVHtOtlc0H6jbBzWQXFfWw6IH8RAmIv3l5DIx0ru7MJi6iN_h4m7YU7fSRCK4Q6LiGKCxQdlNYJgyIwa_ktp4ucFQJErMTLitf8VVhGcodyZBiCudE-xuZvuDh7Kt2-KuBvOiuPWFB9MoA8xkNg4pj61A_oRUyBcoJFOtPZn058OyKSqgZW8XGOetjadirphM88Q=&c=E6ByEsBDpav-k2kyReRlWaIkBWYT7ityNKBXK5GhwhEZ2U3jcQH2AQ==&ch=0p8jg-mJh-Gi6TtHwCsqEvazc05IXGHQmEUMsT0X6cw06MWJcJOXEw==> . And download the white paper <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001dm6dT119uSpgUc4GaOouZUK1CdRPL4viwhKBjomGVHtOtlc0H6jbBzWQXFfWw6IH_cdwudqT8u78uD8QLwoRqU7O0tTryXXmXhaZLQY3PwAfxd9q8XVmWhuYcplWRY3rp644J931sM0Yvn7NCYux7vKNB3v8dJBTHPLPfhqgPTLlPpYVX7x20CbbmHUTNgXUa9zjPxlTSxw=&c=E6ByEsBDpav-k2kyReRlWaIkBWYT7ityNKBXK5GhwhEZ2U3jcQH2AQ==&ch=0p8jg-mJh-Gi6TtHwCsqEvazc05IXGHQmEUMsT0X6cw06MWJcJOXEw==> .

 News Round-Up <http://ih.constantcontact.com/fs116/1102602719219/img/94.jpg>   

Here's today's AdExchanger news round-up... Want it by email?
Sign-up here <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001Dmqngsec1oELmL-zUoMKVdolETmF7yPuY6QhW4eQlBAl9n9-CFVTkJq4SawtbaSW0At19nYVOW_BWt7oVQCjjHbLTs6YOeUBGkkChGwgRGQnYuS2j-jG0ztz7aVdBr3x-AY77ppg2ZEs5QrsJUZyKx2ZBSxyUW2PWe5tZyTWcJpSTWXzgR7mJq1k0SeOHOcj&c=sXZKh4q37usLBD3r4QpVmJxaqlM2HLShQik4prnybFtS3PWfobxejg==&ch=56l3gWxB5d55klUzK9t6pDeKWQGrZ9xuV0C_lSbCaHUB4tjI6FCsOQ==> .

 

Instagram's Agency Deal

 

Omnicom plans to spend up to $100 million on Instagram, according to Ad Age, in a new deal confirmed by Facebook and the agency holding company. With this new deal, Omnicom agencies will have the ability to create ads on the platform. The process will be manual and Instagram will be selective of which photos are used for ads. The plan right now is to have a sponsored photo show up in a user's news feed that will then stay there for an entire day, even if that user logs out and then back in. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001Dmqngsec1oELmL-zUoMKVdolETmF7yPuY6QhW4eQlBAl9n9-CFVTkKxy0wXinExMHXc1hem7yJsyKerJgb4yPA8s6GvkwnkOEKBWK2Vf-t78N3hJyirmV_aQvq23GkeP3NVh6nZwMk5rOAw2mlB-LCjv4lKXNvAE09oyJ5dUadumYzEQfjp31CcxdqMwiEN36c7sY0u6IOr32CbasbHzixQds8qVyED76dfZueNQE3d0l3uGJEGSl7qMUFiZhNJzp2pze_txgAWoUha92jrF-g==&c=sXZKh4q37usLBD3r4QpVmJxaqlM2HLShQik4prnybFtS3PWfobxejg==&ch=56l3gWxB5d55klUzK9t6pDeKWQGrZ9xuV0C_lSbCaHUB4tjI6FCsOQ==> . Programmatic is a ways away, it seems.

 

Data Fears

 

Privacy concerns aren't going away anytime soon, especially as mainstream news outlets are reporting on the practice of data collection and use, such as the latest article from CBS. The news outlet points out the many ways personal data can be distributed, such as to prospective employers or for marketing. "We think that self-regulation has been very effective. ... I think that consumers ought to understand that the Internet is an advertising medium," said Bryan Kennedy, CEO of Epsilon. Read the rest <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001Dmqngsec1oELmL-zUoMKVdolETmF7yPuY6QhW4eQlBAl9n9-CFVTkKxy0wXinExMive8NXy5xhktY_XYX7mKFeHHH6BAc4nHvrfvoXRRTUlJX8SWzfe_1qI-II2_fvUMMuLgmwhd06kc3N4qTBEq2bzxZsX1PTVoKeIr29ybjz9T7OrRq5YxjETNxciwuvFoGrrw9l96St_XSzl-w6vVNiq5c6bM172p&c=sXZKh4q37usLBD3r4QpVmJxaqlM2HLShQik4prnybFtS3PWfobxejg==&ch=56l3gWxB5d55klUzK9t6pDeKWQGrZ9xuV0C_lSbCaHUB4tjI6FCsOQ==> .

 

App And To The Right

 

Flurry takes a look at data from its mobile "pipes" and finds rocketing growth for what it calls personalization apps, a.k.a. Launchers, on the Android platform. From the Flurry blog post: "Q1 2014 (and the quarter is not over yet) usage is higher than all of 2013. While the cumulative reach of these apps is still relatively small (30 million monthly users in the US), the usage growth is eye catching." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001Dmqngsec1oELmL-zUoMKVdolETmF7yPuY6QhW4eQlBAl9n9-CFVTkKxy0wXinExMysBg-oyL-XjsApEOLX05RNHavkKkIonQZ-WmXsYtbdgwltnjg4h8UIewm9hgGKR0w0Z61oQuXRYRmueHDTObsmNeCOvI2uZHukxt-lZbkTu7IS32qA3Q2YNm0v70LB1K-DDPifi0rEgdXLxsUOGvCxgAOp_C8dTr8KwqOr3gDo6WSOehFeC9L919nkmLptt0b0owsGcy0MDxWWfemruACKG5HKcVhd9UEOGfUrP6B407o5i6OFsbZw==&c=sXZKh4q37usLBD3r4QpVmJxaqlM2HLShQik4prnybFtS3PWfobxejg==&ch=56l3gWxB5d55klUzK9t6pDeKWQGrZ9xuV0C_lSbCaHUB4tjI6FCsOQ==> . Related from The New York Times: check out this new "micro-network" for "device specific content" being launched by Cartoon Network - it's all apps <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001Dmqngsec1oELmL-zUoMKVdolETmF7yPuY6QhW4eQlBAl9n9-CFVTkKxy0wXinExMK02RIoblFIoFEIGumFHhtn1fBUCEMEII0P9z9j6FTKuzZDudlCGsKqL9QGumohW0AQUFArdF5jqKZirIvnSqKNe_EzJylFSqX5GN5kM47kCc_NZ-0uFmug_NVJHBYOHeTE0fEAihbMr7IbD2IvqPTdKmp11P09QkHzAJdTQU0MhfAMRId5k9-7eaKAC0pYLNEIy4E1Kk-fe4lkXQzyDOrBC6JPD16ACt&c=sXZKh4q37usLBD3r4QpVmJxaqlM2HLShQik4prnybFtS3PWfobxejg==&ch=56l3gWxB5d55klUzK9t6pDeKWQGrZ9xuV0C_lSbCaHUB4tjI6FCsOQ==> .

 

Mobile And Newspapers

 

The FT reports on new projections for mobile revenues in the United Kingdom by eMarketer: "Mobile ad spending in the UK will surge 90 per cent to 2.26bn ($3.8 billion USD) in 2014. Meanwhile, newspaper ad spending will fall 5 per cent to 2.06bn." Read more (subscription) <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001Dmqngsec1oELmL-zUoMKVdolETmF7yPuY6QhW4eQlBAl9n9-CFVTkKxy0wXinExM4BjK3jOiRhsfO06_l1LCmgoZyqZaNUpJ5fBJCOvlOlDUZZBtPJX1bhOksdUbkymYRb5P9LAOm_qB4a-31AKIGNEmy5sqULc5-RVN433oNsLB06nwEQB5KCgT-FhBFfVXHN9p4leEmjODgEy6LT44e0rwtx96ZsuEr4a5zaCqmTarYshdYKYNgA==&c=sXZKh4q37usLBD3r4QpVmJxaqlM2HLShQik4prnybFtS3PWfobxejg==&ch=56l3gWxB5d55klUzK9t6pDeKWQGrZ9xuV0C_lSbCaHUB4tjI6FCsOQ==> . The FT says that Google's search ad revenue is responsible for a large part of mobile revenues today.

 

IPO Surge

 

There is IPO fever among companies now that hasn't been seen since 2007, with many of the companies being tech-oriented, according to The Wall Street Journal. In the first two months of this year, 42 companies went public, compared to 20 that went public in the first two months of 2013. "If companies feel like they need any more money in the next two to three years, sophisticated companies are doing it now," said Kevin Hartz, chief executive of Eventbrite. Read on <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001Dmqngsec1oELmL-zUoMKVdolETmF7yPuY6QhW4eQlBAl9n9-CFVTkKxy0wXinExMsDwGIDcoVzDacCXGrn9bwdOBBNJ1UN1Rdq7TW9sjCvK2bDv69OhVWN0mfYZ58k0hTuOR7H-bxk-tFykjlqUIKlyGL_-Yg7Us2sVFwTTZIhpSTzhWmvs9um-L2xMHdXgIRyBtkOAbzDPh0Oy4dOE-1XMIbCLfFTjZwsLBTbqF-z2yAO7g2-G8cTRSlSozuEdn&c=sXZKh4q37usLBD3r4QpVmJxaqlM2HLShQik4prnybFtS3PWfobxejg==&ch=56l3gWxB5d55klUzK9t6pDeKWQGrZ9xuV0C_lSbCaHUB4tjI6FCsOQ==> .

Tumbling Ads


In the WSJ, Mike Shields reviews Yahoo Tumblr's ad prospects. He writes, "Ad executives say Tumblr appears to have lost momentum among advertisers since the acquisition, partly because its 'native' ads - which are designed to look like other blog posts - are now more common on other sites." Read it (subscription) <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001Dmqngsec1oELmL-zUoMKVdolETmF7yPuY6QhW4eQlBAl9n9-CFVTkKxy0wXinExMF8mUvwfcsSmj6-HONyL1EluFqr625fuFByr-MaXnDDAQAA9zbEB3WNj7jVATnNWvoLtKQwWSF4EPR25dtqT8-tBvTCA1qxV6FnFHN1T7Vm8UdrVJXkcZTKxj83cO_GOGgo9bKz7hbvDLv2mm9V-EP1KyQ8gmpzi_d4wj5T0DQU9qeuSrr3XApM3IZseVDE2G&c=sXZKh4q37usLBD3r4QpVmJxaqlM2HLShQik4prnybFtS3PWfobxejg==&ch=56l3gWxB5d55klUzK9t6pDeKWQGrZ9xuV0C_lSbCaHUB4tjI6FCsOQ==> .

Sign-up here <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=0018rNPuu-EdkSgHhj-j5_ckj3J5okSXRXlrhBcylQ3ZAQ4v3ud99DEeGNk1Egu70KW5Bg9k8F1LTBDKTFqOvlTo90Eoc_5RgNStpPfYZoQjxU0tVFivA9TiH6VQTmkWZQw2H6J4axpc5htjxBRRc2jUKWpY17HadYtzP9GfPMTJ5Td7boG29BadtLHfj2ED8sh&c=a0Bhnl6uHx2pZ6uS9BNRgflhJ0z7wWMzl-spkmOokil4-MT0OI0sGQ==&ch=rLVQ-5TfQfwLFz_ukvja_x5FMP7ol4hMuLqf-U26KKUCPoZDFTq4_g==> .

 

Time Units


Time Magazine is giving its site a facelift after Time Inc. spins out from its parent company, Time Warner. Time tells Re/code's Peter Kafka that traffic has more than doubled and "video streams are up 860 percent in the last year, and in February the site did 4.4 million streams." Let's do some math...4.4 million streams, assume a pre-roll ad for each and a robust $10 eCPM. That's $44,000 in monthly gross revenue. Still early days. But, Time has big, new ad unit(s)! See it (them) <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=0018rNPuu-EdkSgHhj-j5_ckj3J5okSXRXlrhBcylQ3ZAQ4v3ud99DEeP45Ix_INKxi6pGuL_CGMB3zmKUocRYFSBRp0roEYaz1f0KCWkLHtHUE1C9yWxDfZRk0G0BzkDPCwW00ipXaWkxewTWt8cdpnZJTKkLz2lvf-ocWutW94GHq7CUUy5Ysaa7nhblgS4xdgWRI3WYQwOBlGCGJSaBTgVqoxpLCs9YlRrPYHk__8FWMQ5SXM-4dWHFRMTPXV-y8sin0FXEgdBU=&c=a0Bhnl6uHx2pZ6uS9BNRgflhJ0z7wWMzl-spkmOokil4-MT0OI0sGQ==&ch=rLVQ-5TfQfwLFz_ukvja_x5FMP7ol4hMuLqf-U26KKUCPoZDFTq4_g==> .


From Bricks To Clicks


Staples announced that nearly half of its sales are now generated online, and that spells doom for some of its brick-and-mortar stores. The NY Times explains that the company "aims to close more than 10 percent of its North American stores by the end of next year, up to 225 stores, as part of a plan to save about $500 million." Who will be left for showrooming <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=0018rNPuu-EdkSgHhj-j5_ckj3J5okSXRXlrhBcylQ3ZAQ4v3ud99DEeLaWw5P0cfgwzNEKQkWypYa3CbpE8vL1hkqkwqBfl4ESK8LQ4iHRS_kNMF92tM_tdbqn7_Sfory3F0XVZZY0ZECy_Ib3dC28KVf71ThT8rBSuNHW-zkZFGhYiDxy_ZWAmnzHvWr2jzr_qpGc1PIrnooqjy2VILMIjCxnh9LUie1BT20Ne4MTjyQ=&c=a0Bhnl6uHx2pZ6uS9BNRgflhJ0z7wWMzl-spkmOokil4-MT0OI0sGQ==&ch=rLVQ-5TfQfwLFz_ukvja_x5FMP7ol4hMuLqf-U26KKUCPoZDFTq4_g==> ? Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=0018rNPuu-EdkSgHhj-j5_ckj3J5okSXRXlrhBcylQ3ZAQ4v3ud99DEeP45Ix_INKxiw56DKYsNptpPF6op5AW9rZUOOowd5NX0YbljgCzizejrIRpxeV8W_0Q-bDI6RGCUaRPNQgBMl_aF4AVSbRxzOkWgouZsYbbjtMGP-RF7GZiyI5KocRElR-bkmGU3ZtYk1fiiXUZI_afLPr-Dc0XpMz09OFX2h4Gjol9jT9-fLZhhC6pPvjFGdDifvc9VHJoj&c=a0Bhnl6uHx2pZ6uS9BNRgflhJ0z7wWMzl-spkmOokil4-MT0OI0sGQ==&ch=rLVQ-5TfQfwLFz_ukvja_x5FMP7ol4hMuLqf-U26KKUCPoZDFTq4_g==> .


All Hale Patch


Street Fight has an interview with Charles Hale whose company, Hale Global, acquired AOL's Patch business. Some tidbits from Hale.. on Patch traffic during February: "We're holding steady at 90% of pageviews of the old Patch and 85% of unique visitors."...on Patch profitability: "We were cash-flow and EBITDA positive in February. That's possibly the first profitable month in Patch's history." Patch more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=0018rNPuu-EdkSgHhj-j5_ckj3J5okSXRXlrhBcylQ3ZAQ4v3ud99DEeP45Ix_INKxiO3PxO-GQIggQ8IQFbViKdvMrnCcncsWy0op6BOt5pdiDZQSun-w7xX3PIbdUXYySL_snW82Bf2H4ZvTww0HF7DTXmhyzEVkjxqY68w407ccCyBUK3m5oDV_QzbNBQbuyyTIK3LdVj-iLdCO5MOx5n2H4srizS5APjzonYPKTC3XpwlChB5vtJX9kodjHGqWf44_rTeoFnBoLyZ6qtMyPrP_4qyxkDcrm&c=a0Bhnl6uHx2pZ6uS9BNRgflhJ0z7wWMzl-spkmOokil4-MT0OI0sGQ==&ch=rLVQ-5TfQfwLFz_ukvja_x5FMP7ol4hMuLqf-U26KKUCPoZDFTq4_g==> .


News Feed Ads


For news feed lovers and targeters: The Facebook News Feed is getting a bit of a makeover. TechCrunch reports on the cosmetic nip and tuck: "new font for the bulk of the text (...); a new 'card' arrangement; bolder presentation for images; and a lighter and more simplified left-hand column." Read more on what that means <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=0018rNPuu-EdkSgHhj-j5_ckj3J5okSXRXlrhBcylQ3ZAQ4v3ud99DEeP45Ix_INKxii4MSdt7mWcc8MW-NyR9IsgJhElax9KtSaVhL0_aVlRfhTMrwfGvxP7sEzmQo3Wr7joNLIoax1NyWuoDtiKrh0ouMjpdNZ2H6EAfI7mOWtinT7ezJ6QvI8-_adXZJoiltxd_xB_7OrqSQkDb_dyg613IBI6XzeRy17iGsEits_V8Hokcl5FKpzkiDZV5tsOeVjiKKvoQE9Q7jEX0V7gFpv8_T0T2DtBhIIoh47cYpdSMufGhAxZYPHB_6NWtmHQ6OTWk7YhwlFCs=&c=a0Bhnl6uHx2pZ6uS9BNRgflhJ0z7wWMzl-spkmOokil4-MT0OI0sGQ==&ch=rLVQ-5TfQfwLFz_ukvja_x5FMP7ol4hMuLqf-U26KKUCPoZDFTq4_g==> . Don't worry, ad placements remain the same.


Geotargeting Nilla Wafers


Are you a Globaltrotter with an urge for Nilla Wafers? This one's for you. Ad Age's E.J. Schultz reports that Mondelez (Nilla brand owner and many others <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=0018rNPuu-EdkSgHhj-j5_ckj3J5okSXRXlrhBcylQ3ZAQ4v3ud99DEeP45Ix_INKxiBC1dimIJjkAOukwEeysGqUgHmeQH8rgHrwXV2G60h-3tAmNFHB-9VvYXOa3lWgudZVSNaABvwP1Lrh-nPu-E-ma6Qm9H_n0zy66a_PANS_eeU4SNc95ePoxOhI8lMjKn44uof0TeqGU=&c=a0Bhnl6uHx2pZ6uS9BNRgflhJ0z7wWMzl-spkmOokil4-MT0OI0sGQ==&ch=rLVQ-5TfQfwLFz_ukvja_x5FMP7ol4hMuLqf-U26KKUCPoZDFTq4_g==> ) and Facebook have joined hands, which will allow Mondelez to address you with Mondelez brand ads wherever you are. He writes, "The pact, which is being described as a 'global strategic partnership,' covers 52 countries including the U.S. and will go 'beyond a traditional media buy' to include "a joint commitment to innovation, opportunities to opt into Facebook's beta-testing programs, access to research and capability-building through immersion days in priority markets..." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=0018rNPuu-EdkSgHhj-j5_ckj3J5okSXRXlrhBcylQ3ZAQ4v3ud99DEeP45Ix_INKxiFBiYibecwQd3hB6-zfNzUSh5PGd4N7N7-packUOni5eL4TIgACRrDune6LVj_R3oCcHKVS4Pwp59Pj4nFXrENyWrHnA8_Dwsy2bpCuJ6m0M5P-jkZYAsnQpjX5EFylzSxeu52yP-d5aW2J2mMtnqSYn-fbji4s-04Wv7Yce9EiF1rIQqpyy7tpDUlYFcGh8GV_e0IPaCH3g=&c=a0Bhnl6uHx2pZ6uS9BNRgflhJ0z7wWMzl-spkmOokil4-MT0OI0sGQ==&ch=rLVQ-5TfQfwLFz_ukvja_x5FMP7ol4hMuLqf-U26KKUCPoZDFTq4_g==> .

SDK Consolidation


Fuse Powered <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=0018rNPuu-EdkSgHhj-j5_ckj3J5okSXRXlrhBcylQ3ZAQ4v3ud99DEeP45Ix_INKxicTBFMWMITt80EewyNw8JmqVFmnYGRGWa01APxl3IGpx3zWRF2f1EUQAEuafUJr5XYuqEDt6R4qLOqZS3pJb2bjxaJn6JN6sfP41Cb8mTF98=&c=a0Bhnl6uHx2pZ6uS9BNRgflhJ0z7wWMzl-spkmOokil4-MT0OI0sGQ==&ch=rLVQ-5TfQfwLFz_ukvja_x5FMP7ol4hMuLqf-U26KKUCPoZDFTq4_g==>  is launching a service, called AdRally <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=0018rNPuu-EdkSgHhj-j5_ckj3J5okSXRXlrhBcylQ3ZAQ4v3ud99DEeP45Ix_INKxiknTxN97g1bIy7Iq9KcOJEeg7_EbsqL3PriOa5H9iO6e5COQaw07pqd61xMOlwI0_ghTwzcc8HTibeXbRRrTXYbkQRg1eZPAXdd3BNQC8Lda6PBZWKwyKu4rQPPXeZdKR&c=a0Bhnl6uHx2pZ6uS9BNRgflhJ0z7wWMzl-spkmOokil4-MT0OI0sGQ==&ch=rLVQ-5TfQfwLFz_ukvja_x5FMP7ol4hMuLqf-U26KKUCPoZDFTq4_g==> , to help mobile app developers deal with the multitude of ad networks that are currently available. The company eliminates the need for developers to integrate multiple SDKs, similar to what Burstly and PlayHaven Kontagent do, as noted by VentureBeat. Read the rest <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=0018rNPuu-EdkSgHhj-j5_ckj3J5okSXRXlrhBcylQ3ZAQ4v3ud99DEeP45Ix_INKxiMmP0wPielfg7d67FvIXMV66bAci8At1lfkaZAV-_7CXDM7RbrsUZHly9rsdu4JWk9XvgMmRApoPjMb65vQz3WA7s646Jm338io4tFzYBDW5WGbUtwPeXQlvWMuONPURkj1HwYxrRwP_o-6Wh9O78sKzesB8h-3dDQ7bT784wPjgSk2LhZZPwtxsYLuv32fiAX0jhmoMu2HIuw0ho79oNtOkFTbDTOByR9_W47_fpHTvev_7BuZAKNmoEbmuCnbSPJKtt_9RtN_w=&c=a0Bhnl6uHx2pZ6uS9BNRgflhJ0z7wWMzl-spkmOokil4-MT0OI0sGQ==&ch=rLVQ-5TfQfwLFz_ukvja_x5FMP7ol4hMuLqf-U26KKUCPoZDFTq4_g==> .

 News Round-Up <http://ih.constantcontact.com/fs116/1102602719219/img/94.jpg>   

Here's today's AdExchanger news round-up... Want it by email?

New Video iAds


Apple will begin selling interstitial video iAds later this year, reported Ad Age. The video ads will play automatically within iPhone and iPad apps, according to Ad Age's Tim Peterson, who cited unnamed sources. "The in-app video ads may be a way for Apple to rekindle advertisers' interests in its fancy-but-flawed iAds," Peterson writes. It remains unclear how Apple will sell the video iAds, but the company is also rumored to be launching an ad exchange. Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001Yu7rvVAxt_fJjJ0KO9zjaguHmL59t57ecwZwtyXqE0G7Tr2MdQ7Fl865tg4I3M2EJmUCGVe1am4fp9-mgDbezuib3FPqADemBG890vDnMO3lUNHw69utxv0z4W-VijV7ahSPcF__1VCl2jguiJn4J1lkRiWAlncSy2MWTmOeWDOYpadaogj0SgmfszNsNbSN4wrVyDt-0HepJUA6xB5DXEWOxkRop2hWWDeu6DsmPHEl2UI4dYTEbFWPlebBoxNtK6Q_I2GrowmdM4CnGt0cYQ==&c=NApT-3XD1nr6gRsX_3YfoXSn2g37aJTsZPEARaps4APR2wlDWZNPtg==&ch=nrPWqumAYgRakiD835i5l0WiF8RUT3OYDDf7yDyUAK7IQru2-4MQLQ==> 


The Luxury Of Privacy


Julia Angwin, author and journalist ("What They Know <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001Yu7rvVAxt_fJjJ0KO9zjaguHmL59t57ecwZwtyXqE0G7Tr2MdQ7Fl_UVXQWbre-hqcPB1q9x3y7xtVrEt-zlTltSvMd8l0dxsubG_TH-2XzdhCCqwy7Qe3MbHCBBt2Yv3I2FDePqu1U2PXoceeQJYDPdZ7O2Rg36D2cUZWhtQSt9XXgYZc9RLW22_gYj83YBuTLcBK8qa-nzEUdKmNYXRC03gvc00kWLIoR-cOFwqxw=&c=NApT-3XD1nr6gRsX_3YfoXSn2g37aJTsZPEARaps4APR2wlDWZNPtg==&ch=nrPWqumAYgRakiD835i5l0WiF8RUT3OYDDf7yDyUAK7IQru2-4MQLQ==> " - WSJ, 2010-2012), wanted to know just how much it would cost for her to live a totally private life online. What she found was that it was expensive and difficult to avoid any and all data collection and use of her personal information. Angwin details exactly the steps she went through to accomplish her goal in an op-ed for The New York Times. Read here <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001Yu7rvVAxt_fJjJ0KO9zjaguHmL59t57ecwZwtyXqE0G7Tr2MdQ7Fl865tg4I3M2ES-k1t7TS-rG9atiNYiLnN5wDXZTK40B7P7yrrKoOC-nGHz0M-TfUBwiVI6Ehj65BJ8rt9U7f2OU22fvA8AAk_CZ3CMwPf8VD8IJqE0n-LNhDmzaZaZ4R_S3Dc4D6UnVx99ox4Fb5KLAyPvrysL8yrss8qJtm4M-vwox_Ub1nAJl6S91DYEmUpFb6mt8h087i9udCGdCo7Yw=&c=NApT-3XD1nr6gRsX_3YfoXSn2g37aJTsZPEARaps4APR2wlDWZNPtg==&ch=nrPWqumAYgRakiD835i5l0WiF8RUT3OYDDf7yDyUAK7IQru2-4MQLQ==> .


Yahoo Exclusive


Yahoo is slowly discontinuing sign-ins from Google and Facebook to its properties, including Yahoo Sports and Flickr. The first site to drop support for these logins is Tourney Pick 'Em, a site dedicated to the NCAA basketball tournament, according to Reuters. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001Yu7rvVAxt_fJjJ0KO9zjaguHmL59t57ecwZwtyXqE0G7Tr2MdQ7Fl865tg4I3M2EmV_aksUr2JPApz4PBwAYqM1naaSm1xojHGh7Guto2lj1cHrSpctMWQbdZpY6XQtScAemwdj2SqxhQpUFkp2_FxbAyNlVG9gCQHgak_qx-wyQIDU6ph-usjKwt1M2tpOqIyJNyIdZ8oAgEblIMisbCSi95piNA9uqjfj0HXdAIuIhFqVawJAnhCNqQ95GCOL9&c=NApT-3XD1nr6gRsX_3YfoXSn2g37aJTsZPEARaps4APR2wlDWZNPtg==&ch=nrPWqumAYgRakiD835i5l0WiF8RUT3OYDDf7yDyUAK7IQru2-4MQLQ==> . This move may grow Yahoo's logged-in audience, but that's only if its users are completely dedicated to its services.


Mobile Funds


Mobile attribution company AppsFlyer, also a Facebook Mobile Measurement Partner, raised $7.1 million in funding. According to the press release, AppsFlyer is operating with an annual run rate of $500 million in mobile ad spend through its "pipes," and the company is profitable. Read the release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001Yu7rvVAxt_fJjJ0KO9zjaguHmL59t57ecwZwtyXqE0G7Tr2MdQ7Fl865tg4I3M2EshjiQR98cNXOGhoDppc0-v6Hy50OPoAbqc3K0A8DW3UeEyuhoTMpe_Mwy-_H0V-adZHfjICB9w00y7XgIHLqHk5cXWHchrTuag1VNZL2L7NHuZatCNuxzZiBspaV94fU1A-8wG2JXVIK8GYptfdDB9toIzXqjD_inqsoRl6q498p4huIgY-1R64jV-8TrMFlY1p0E800qcuFinDLHPgHwqIvIVT_RE4-Vd7wUQRbdfob8Y6ly8_KDw==&c=NApT-3XD1nr6gRsX_3YfoXSn2g37aJTsZPEARaps4APR2wlDWZNPtg==&ch=nrPWqumAYgRakiD835i5l0WiF8RUT3OYDDf7yDyUAK7IQru2-4MQLQ==> .


More To Foursquare


Foursquare is fighting for relevance in the rapidly changing app market, but the company isn't ready to sell yet. CEO Dennis Crowley spoke to CNBC, saying people aren't aware of Foursquare's features beyond the quintessential check-in. Although the app is low on the list of popular social networking apps, Crowley believes the next move for the company is reaching users without them even thinking about the app. Watch the video <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001Yu7rvVAxt_fJjJ0KO9zjaguHmL59t57ecwZwtyXqE0G7Tr2MdQ7Fl865tg4I3M2ELD1wFqr8FjQ-MGIMlxg4Hnl6vW41gtBxXRdX3WFMDod8fBTqc0PjCt3BvNxT27snvJBwwOQiYHfK1Ciy7x8OgyHCGA_RgIE1RSR2v3OPN1oSuqqEruYJ6XslC63rpn714D1UARmV4s2-4r1Nvu8rhCYg7lk2t73y&c=NApT-3XD1nr6gRsX_3YfoXSn2g37aJTsZPEARaps4APR2wlDWZNPtg==&ch=nrPWqumAYgRakiD835i5l0WiF8RUT3OYDDf7yDyUAK7IQru2-4MQLQ==> .

Real-Time Fraud


Ad analytics platform Pixalate is adding real-time fraud detection and prevention to its platform. Although Pixalate offers free analytics and fraud detection, this service will require a subscription. According to PandoDaily, the service will work across display, mobile and video. Read on <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001Yu7rvVAxt_fJjJ0KO9zjaguHmL59t57ecwZwtyXqE0G7Tr2MdQ7Fl865tg4I3M2ElRcorvoIxCEUE_D6-btuwRb1_GavNseDf8gI2UqgJIdX_mQP7bWHEQLdv_JpNwMaBYTHj88GbHWE38t_EzesTLsPrV0oPk9v_oFMCfp3s6x5OC0ncKcGG7bSIWTNOPyzh5h4eSf_PuwSFwi6dbxSDFkFxt75PUbbFWJIGxdjMug3pxzsiR0uJLBw62UdkPbOsg0FLTW1xDIpr7rFHStuh_x86ODou0d_F-xmaMNxWSlc593dFoPkqNFoda6xklvc&c=NApT-3XD1nr6gRsX_3YfoXSn2g37aJTsZPEARaps4APR2wlDWZNPtg==&ch=nrPWqumAYgRakiD835i5l0WiF8RUT3OYDDf7yDyUAK7IQru2-4MQLQ==> .


Tumblr's Path


The direction Yahoo would take Tumblr after acquiring the service wasn't clear, but the company claims that there has been success with advertising, according to The Street. On an earnings call, CEO Marissa Mayer said that the average sponsored post is reblogged 10,000 times. "The re-blogging capability of Tumblr is phenomenal," CFO Ken Goldman said. "It's very successful." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001Yu7rvVAxt_fJjJ0KO9zjaguHmL59t57ecwZwtyXqE0G7Tr2MdQ7Fl865tg4I3M2EPtBmp1zxqIPIgv_qFY1Bj-PRDbvYyRXJggGbcMtB_5aVtkF9cWm9xmIulHrqXAMMNMgcqbH0uWG69-O7QivDyJvuanOTGuzme03q9hIQOylDgkMistZRyXHa3EIJVr_DqPQhosNGDnXqEfjK3QFigOsE9PZYb9owssFZ6CaqQwUmEYKoJ9Axp02axJBZ4dJqYWo99mamfPcf5AO_pIkt0g==&c=NApT-3XD1nr6gRsX_3YfoXSn2g37aJTsZPEARaps4APR2wlDWZNPtg==&ch=nrPWqumAYgRakiD835i5l0WiF8RUT3OYDDf7yDyUAK7IQru2-4MQLQ==> .


Publishers On Automation


Jay Sears, SVP for marketplace development at Rubicon Project, asked nine publishers six questions about automation. The responses are collected on Myers Biz Net and include pricing segmentation, sales compensation and transparency. Read more.


InMail Extension


LinkedIn is expanding its InMail native ad format to include mobile. There is some customization of the messages allowed, including calls-to-action, and notifications are delivered to users on both desktop and mobile when a sponsored message is received. Read the rest <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001Yu7rvVAxt_fJjJ0KO9zjaguHmL59t57ecwZwtyXqE0G7Tr2MdQ7Fl865tg4I3M2EpjULDIMtrQd6_knwQnlrIgGBfrVaCfAa9JHDsp3I-vozAFSMiaX-IAMPnUoGidBbsl5BwIaqwCp5z8OKBh2jmGWbsOGSMizjFM-bYYk_GZk8X9Llf1Z69gKBkqsO1TpWj5IRJuiXF3NcwW0Cu_HhqLiMa2-OnrBasIJfsbAnJL1vV8hwm44sSoMKK-b7-n0q&c=NApT-3XD1nr6gRsX_3YfoXSn2g37aJTsZPEARaps4APR2wlDWZNPtg==&ch=nrPWqumAYgRakiD835i5l0WiF8RUT3OYDDf7yDyUAK7IQru2-4MQLQ==> .

Easy Fraud


Fraud is a problem, but just how easy is it for someone to set up a site, load it up with inventory and then rake in the ad revenue? Digiday's Jack Marshall did the legwork to find out and reported his findings. It turns out it's very cheap and easy, and he generated a 30% profit in a matter of days from Sovrn. "Our system was designed for very long-tail publishers, and clearly this is a loophole that we did not anticipate someone exploiting," Walter Knapp, CEO of Sovrn Holdings, said. Read the rest <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001fUek3f789J9_CIOD3EAHGjXCQheKa5gHTf7zwAqDFJ6ivxOqzgEufnbGzBD4Vta2GqNWADUXibZDZdFYi0s3lKQPqmkwK4VZvZ-h9i81gVBmmtIfp9bSws6zv129MwGTjgNFUQvnJyO67g5VcSwiRM-uto4P3J8EdB5SdS5GHppZoCc0E97arr1fehTar--AjMDxfw1DaSS9Ii8Ig_Zrlg==&c=VNINABfcNquu9SBlwwQ_6Fumqug_oi79_u-9xVKz8pEg8XtQFgy7ig==&ch=Ig9fX7Wi9qBAyCwBhG78GaNWIO_RDvB-JFcT85V-X47Z7ZhBhOjB9A==> .


Measuring Radio


Triton Digital earned accreditation from the Media Ratings Council <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001fUek3f789J9_CIOD3EAHGjXCQheKa5gHTf7zwAqDFJ6ivxOqzgEufnbGzBD4Vta2xAvacJEhPH2wA2Tw7b6poTk4IhQetiVsh26ryG45PP6fAAG5TL2TvWCBBDt2e-m84mVIW2TC4j4AytUdqAnBEUgLfXlYa-Hzk2NWUoCN4HG39MA4HYjYQ48rBL7IsVJ4t8BBeZw9idLmIvWO4_Iecef6NuvLrdRmN1gbGJsopHX1FhIdoeQOyA==&c=VNINABfcNquu9SBlwwQ_6Fumqug_oi79_u-9xVKz8pEg8XtQFgy7ig==&ch=Ig9fX7Wi9qBAyCwBhG78GaNWIO_RDvB-JFcT85V-X47Z7ZhBhOjB9A==> , bridging the gap between digital and terrestrial radio local ad buying capabilities. "What this does is give our clients a seat at the big boy's table, which is the $17 billion terrestrial advertising industry," Triton chief strategy officer Patrick Reynolds told VentureBeat. "Clients like Pandora now have an equal opportunity to compete for the same advertisers that buy local advertising on terrestrial stations." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001fUek3f789J9_CIOD3EAHGjXCQheKa5gHTf7zwAqDFJ6ivxOqzgEufnbGzBD4Vta2H2vzEzg4t1I5OzqkgxgovdG6jPS_dLp7qqJkTUN2N8rxyUl0PvdeW1PqKFqtg0rVBoA0Fw9mjuIYrdUYBkZtQGPvKu59RNPOfyL8q97eX700r5-7rj5gTu0x8ZJ_L7pkY-Vmt7S4GTXxC6qUJ4hKfpDC88m62Rcrhod_GGFZWZ8mCpq6H7niIPJ8EIbjqSh3M0GvMHqYK5jscp4aquDX8Q==&c=VNINABfcNquu9SBlwwQ_6Fumqug_oi79_u-9xVKz8pEg8XtQFgy7ig==&ch=Ig9fX7Wi9qBAyCwBhG78GaNWIO_RDvB-JFcT85V-X47Z7ZhBhOjB9A==> .


The Customer View


Marketo is experiencing a shift from B2B marketing to B2C marketing, the company's CEO, Phil Hernandez, told Ad Age. "We see this complete crossover starting to happen between the techniques and systems that grew up in the b-to-b world now being applied into consumer marketing applications." Hernandez predicts that B2C could account for 60% of Marketo's business by 2016. Read on <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001fUek3f789J9_CIOD3EAHGjXCQheKa5gHTf7zwAqDFJ6ivxOqzgEufnbGzBD4Vta2dCs6RfEMKEJmHquf8wvr1n5vn6jqMwIbNDH82Fj3g9VASBGINhekmvdzmZ6INPic-l8MW6U_oZdyMOO5yPZNx0SezOBWwp9O31zZ5-kgKegNDZUjqL47LG9UqPktsLc85ZW-b7e2KTt1QLjIOKfoZMb70TcCQq1dEayJbVfS7MfCA_U3d794rw==&c=VNINABfcNquu9SBlwwQ_6Fumqug_oi79_u-9xVKz8pEg8XtQFgy7ig==&ch=Ig9fX7Wi9qBAyCwBhG78GaNWIO_RDvB-JFcT85V-X47Z7ZhBhOjB9A==> .


Weather Front


During its "allfront" sales event in New York today, The Weather Company boasted 136 million app installs and claimed advances in helping advertisers target based on weather data -- such as dialing up beer ads ahead of heat waves. "Based on the success of a few major marketers having a weather strategy in 2013, we are now in the position to work with marketers to transact on sales that have the enterprise scale and analytics capability to partner with us," chief global revenue officer Curt Hecht told attendees, according to a release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001fUek3f789J9_CIOD3EAHGjXCQheKa5gHTf7zwAqDFJ6ivxOqzgEufnbGzBD4Vta2wBE05cNvg7Y-PacRPo88CuZag5RPj3TBVbq0aBOF8K-XmeMl3n9ed6WP-s40wJpoDSIl9CZhlMUSRhzu2TxMiZsZfNvvl3oPdrlX87vJZJTOXyiy6UTtog==&c=VNINABfcNquu9SBlwwQ_6Fumqug_oi79_u-9xVKz8pEg8XtQFgy7ig==&ch=Ig9fX7Wi9qBAyCwBhG78GaNWIO_RDvB-JFcT85V-X47Z7ZhBhOjB9A==> .


Good Bad News


Demand-side platform Brandscreen's chief revenue officer Jo Gaines tells AdNews in Australia that her company has been bought by U.S.-based Zenovia for an undisclosed sum. Gaines tells Adnews "that Brandscreen was seeking a buyer for some time before the administrators were appointed. She said the deal means it can bring back some staff made redundant and build out its products and reach. 'It's a good news story and a sign of the [programmatic industry] consolidation that has long been predicted.'" Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001fUek3f789J9_CIOD3EAHGjXCQheKa5gHTf7zwAqDFJ6ivxOqzgEufnbGzBD4Vta2AEPspUwJgM4eDkfl4gIjEEI3fuXqeXVG-Rw6oknJUHkDZJvw0GoRNtvDaSBJ5yriC9677UvgD9gNkp07-RX7wKTPDvssAgX-nd3PACQ_WHgJi-TeXGgbOk2hJo6pG36YCemAkAgC7XwWFVQXvvT4U1u0by6GG6sfVAimbqnlj5VVZ9KICk-z-IyP3F1nN2NrCPopX2JZiYO7RQJMT-8uREy59eR2H4zlFF7XDshKa3IayUVyOKGDoaNuPe0UptIS9WAs9X7Qf6DYdF41pqdKPA==&c=VNINABfcNquu9SBlwwQ_6Fumqug_oi79_u-9xVKz8pEg8XtQFgy7ig==&ch=Ig9fX7Wi9qBAyCwBhG78GaNWIO_RDvB-JFcT85V-X47Z7ZhBhOjB9A==> .

February M&A


Boutique investment bank Petsky Prunier has tallied mergers and acquisitions for February and reports that 444 transactions took place. Furthermore, "Marketing Technology was the most active segment with 97 transactions, respectively. Traditional Media was the highest value segment with 16 deals, of which eight were worth $45.4 billion in aggregate reported value. eCommerce and Mobile Content/Apps were the most active subsegments across all segments, with 35 and 25 transactions..." Download the PDF <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001fUek3f789J9_CIOD3EAHGjXCQheKa5gHTf7zwAqDFJ6ivxOqzgEufnbGzBD4Vta28TFwQ7404CAyCJnQ6T0IcOOhlvDsgUjtkZihHmU8qQxGpPSjbKi2qBcWaXT5XSYVoDMFShm6NnJS0d29MuqS1j8YrlxC7tzlQC0YOBLidvxZTm5aDtBT8xQSfrymavr8NVxPVLLOMKZHl4wpEHfL_gbn2YcT-VuIS9qliWLkpLrn5k-1YkyVKqlqAwPlVodhxyM7j5E4N-o4FJ6a9wrsoA==&c=VNINABfcNquu9SBlwwQ_6Fumqug_oi79_u-9xVKz8pEg8XtQFgy7ig==&ch=Ig9fX7Wi9qBAyCwBhG78GaNWIO_RDvB-JFcT85V-X47Z7ZhBhOjB9A==> .

 News Round-Up <http://ih.constantcontact.com/fs116/1102602719219/img/94.jpg>   

Here's today's AdExchanger news round-up... Want it by email?
Sign-up here <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001D4qaYCCFFOH4T8QLxkexT7LY5W3M86Hbsk2_ljpyPyvnGExut52PEPPM5oPpvOCIYFcCPmRE8S_WuuJi5BRaCCz1EOBlt95JKmq2szkaOf2wZuDjBlXAviUV_PbJq_Z2Y5Nsd9QuRL8=> .

 

Preeeemium


Guardian Media Group CEO Andrew Miller is crowing about his company's latest results as display ads take center stage. The company is apparently about to report its biggest rise in revenue since the financial crisis in the late 00s. Miller tells the FT, "People are buying our digital display and paying a premium. The model that we're following is definitely working for us." Read more (subscription) <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001D4qaYCCFFOHvDMhAfPSeaIISvXHXlSmErWoVhXYfW-jgjlU-9zBpWg6BQh-o5YYbLZOTLwZta2qgjk6jEHUZNtQ6b25BvX1iEDTOn3FeHrwgi2JEOA3rU41FxxDFMr9hzNzHOWXHwEX0nyaqX8NUth0MvwouUHmwZqwnt6FXrWEBYAbt01NYWsixoxu4Q9ZY> .


Zynga Mobile


In an effort to rekindle some past success from hit titles such as Words With Friends and FarmVille, Zynga is making a big mobile effort. According to Re/code, the company plans to release new versions of these titles along with Zynga poker and focus more on short bursts of gameplay, which is often the style with mobile games. Read on <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001D4qaYCCFFOHHBKC0kzAnq_f91kQ8sQn_RX14qwlLbOCLGW4dUg6TWeMOpY6P4qJJUz-hZIRgerYd6rXhqCCCA-rFOf77FKwfh0NqrWksaGhgJLRiMfsoG-jXt1QRTSPwR9rm_G5DUQvUCrqNPBy11ZVZOVchVaNYzbYWehjH9HCora_old_hMA0F90VMSVIxWjfaIGlV634=> .


Tablet Share


Android's tablet market share has overtaken Apple's for the top spot worldwide, according to new Gartner data. As TechCrunch notes, Microsoft still lags far behind in the tablet world. The trend is toward smaller screens with cheaper prices. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001D4qaYCCFFOEkeV90qunKS-HpWP9DIwiwDWbiUs3DtlBTxAJjIMZdUSkV6vDtzc20dLWCIltplHQz5Hv-YLR2L-SkcHE6q8aeZjmhSFIFIrd0JdYPmgbQbvaVlyfoeDk_Mp7VvE2sr6tAd6hFBDQPszYqQCKLm7vwOglA1CEk46Q3rELeeJTjowfoJt38zcMJtJmJRWP1G6vlTp4LobBdq6PWyxCAUn3uIQXgG7MxyP5okWfjoi0mdAKnBTWuUId_> . As tablet adoption grows advertisers may need to think of specific strategies for the devices.


Luxury Product


The New York Times covers the rebirth of Newsweek thanks to its tiny new owner, IBT Media. The Times' Leslie Kaufmann says digital will not be the only saving grace for Newsweek, with print plans in the works: "[IBT] plans to print 70,000 copies [of Newsweek] - at its peak two decades ago, circulation was 3.3 million - and sell them for $7.99 each, with the magazine's content also available online for a more affordable price. 'You would pay only if you don't want to read anything on a backlit screen," [CEO Etienne] Uzac said. 'It is a luxury product.'" Read it <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001D4qaYCCFFOEctKnU8Ly7AUqImG8utYw-yeHRMeUfdMKEvQB8MysYS_l89VCtlDZHf86xrhUucDo1FjJd6FFaxhbqra2A3qCdg6ih4FtWJ40f7tDdeYvIWiX1UzW_or2vOfl1rr-7mCAUj9DNWudq5Ty6RSBed-if84Zz_RTYmPjRb66Z8wa0IudMqsh3iIbPZ-kMEUuZJOBslXH1MnfOyMlIhrYLPAGD8nPqmizyla2Qae6plv3yUQ==> .


Finding The TV Audience


Videology is getting Nielsen's TV data in a move that will let its advertisers target TV audiences online - and vice versa. "Prior tools allowed advertisers to find TV audiences online, whereas now advertisers can also find digital audiences on TV," says the press release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001D4qaYCCFFOFrKrMHD98QGoGAOPf2B1wgwKqmac8o2lPPChTkxjfLMdIUMvjBbNEOg7ctYnWJYtP2Tze2OXII90M1FtmK4JsJnv7eyWYP3L59JzE4x3boHEhB0GxgyU-jtG2yuDo401tMp14eUtwb-oLkRYtNj_9vS3HJWiSDQnLtnKI8rRnE_CobHdU6pnzc0dWm1xvYOBvg3tTQ4HaDPw==> . Part of the deal's promise is "reach extension" for broadcasters.

Video Acquisition


Over the weekend, Ryan Lawler said in TechCrunch that, according to his sources, Comcast will buy video platform Freewheel for $320 million. Lawler explains, "Comcast, of course, is interested in owning the technology for its own video ad platform. That said, FreeWheel is expected to continue serving outside clients, particularly the networks that the cable company has partnered with for its own TV Everywhere services." Read it <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001Cwjo3ck_yx1uLPzXwYwJ8WwXK6zJ9e1VCozs3H9G_pROW_bLXpYGnJBwWdEleJwoS3HdPXc6XmqALZw59btFl9rlZynIFgAUfT6sDkLav2SCss6lmocjb0ligq1e9tQK3Xoq7uF3DVh23yuIg3_N9d5FHKCfxB9hQiXtchRdmck=> .


Programmatic Defined


Bob Arnold gives his take on programmatic in a Q&A with the ANA's Ken Beaulieu for MediaPost. Arnold defines programmatic as "utilizing technology to plan and buy media in order to reach the right person with the right message when they're most receptive. It eliminates a lot of the guesswork of media buying." Read the rest <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001Cwjo3ck_yx0y35LfBfQclT5HHBgT8hWurd6j0J2WVQ-NNuU4-1Oq2V9LoU4a_sfd4_0-HbZMyUxg3KN6Z0LrKFXe53jsVkqDwBoTx0eglE1MHnmXkeV8m5-Pfm73QSBBidKO5FAqFD6b3p4ln9ajZwmn5G8uG_LRjVOdoWBnFIzC21JwvfWhz2RhKLjaeV5Yw3TDLefjp7pqRwvLD3_blZn-XB0XY6CA> .


This Is How It Is


On Digiday, John McDermott says that Facebook isn't making any friends on Madison Avenue. He writes, "Facebook is not yet good at the agency game, where buyers are used to being wined and dined. Like Google before it, Facebook often gives off a blunt, 'this is how it is' approach. Agencies are under more pressure to prove their worth and fear being cut out of the equation by technology platforms." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001Cwjo3ck_yx1fOaDxoTyJkSi1chGVd5OzHiE66PTMTmVDqdOZjMwvKau8q2wQH-Oglds4LGrpYnWnCXPQz50cfJ57eCShCoWQakBjRsioNQaZXlyGVCmZ0C9nyYAxQ9BgmmRKz5OcwE40sFH1Nwj4MYimtBjNJ99f> . Meanwhile, ad prices may be rising on Facebook according to an Inside Facebook article <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001Cwjo3ck_yx0fqh6jJ7g6um1-q6JotbbqEBt6IZfHD4K1po8e0mw4ukizO18SJ8xeiCTyApZOYaMTgmN8nwR3qfgzje9xmAglDl2SSucl_PrDbtsGsoy_oWsc5dyjDT2Z-OdklH0vy8mWq1-5fAmI3pkdtII_ujimSapvn1nwcQy58i2PwerwfqMug2FEIJ8Lgo_oq2cV1Wj0_9tFlqkgX4jRkvesEMWS> .


Guaranteed Display


Display ad platform iSocket announced iSocket for Advertisers as it looks to plant a flag in the programmatic guaranteed marketplace. MediaPost's Laurie Sullivan explains, "Media buyers at agencies and brands can browse iFA's publisher catalog and buy reserved inventory directly from any of iSocket's publishers, like Microsoft, Conde Nast, Reuters and Forbes." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001Cwjo3ck_yx2C6d_yXyUhsk6lNyENSxtNnWUHY6spHghLF-twqSU6TE_mBSpSRgNqkqhYIMsfaavYGpnF8gaC2Cd8Lkn59hQcwd3lBmEd9fUjFKbc7QDomaKluatya-zH8eKah2VqT8VJiqumXwttdE9jxK-_bYafCRPCbfxfmNDh8ereMV6d6LGLcuu2Jm2M2m-ORFHzXAnSEFQgSai3pk23XjIwZbjY> .


Hot Links


Marketing Land looks at some new referral data for news sites in a report from Web analytics company Parse.ly. Matt McGee writes, "In January, Parse.ly says traffic from Google sites to its network was about 38 percent of all referrals, down from 44 percent in October. Over the same period, Facebook referral traffic rose from 16 to 26 percent. In other words, a gap of 28 percentage points in October dropped to just 12 in January." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001Cwjo3ck_yx1xhSs0Gtgd5CS3j5QtrmTiB4Vut-ojpN_1jhyVDeRalgfRlWGf-0Sp-kzjkAUegCdQWvKPT8KmF3MGYqc3oKMc-8pclmmBtWxyo9eLMzw24zAe5M35LWMk2dL6B2giIsS8LS4FtBw2SLg6NLybsFQhXtCaKwC-lzvhefB0EsgmFBDVOJo4qwQi98ILZdxlNMEg34F0I8XTZ0UqHw1zfYb2> .
